1954 while(numcodes_cl > 4u && tree_cl.lengths[CLCL_ORDER[numcodes_cl - 1u]] == 0) {
1955 numcodes_cl--;
1956 }
1957
1958 /*
1959 Write everything into the output
1960
1961 After the BFINAL and BTYPE, the dynamic block consists out of the following:
1962 - 5 bits HLIT, 5 bits HDIST, 4 bits HCLEN
1963 - (HCLEN+4)*3 bits code lengths of code length alphabet
1964 - HLIT + 257 code lengths of lit/length alphabet (encoded using the code length
1965 alphabet, + possible repetition codes 16, 17, 18)
1966 - HDIST + 1 code lengths of distance alphabet (encoded using the code length
1967 alphabet, + possible repetition codes 16, 17, 18)
1968 - compressed data
1969 - 256 (end code)
1970 */
1971
1972 /*Write block type*/
1973 writeBits(writer, BFINAL, 1);
1974 writeBits(writer, 0, 1); /*first bit of BTYPE "dynamic"*/
1975 writeBits(writer, 1, 1); /*second bit of BTYPE "dynamic"*/
1976
1977 /*write the HLIT, HDIST and HCLEN values*/
1978 /*all three sizes take trimmed ending zeroes into account, done either by HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies
1979 or in the loop for numcodes_cl above, which saves space. */
1980 HLIT = (unsigned)(numcodes_ll - 257);
1981 HDIST = (unsigned)(numcodes_d - 1);
1982 HCLEN = (unsigned)(numcodes_cl - 4);
1983 writeBits(writer, HLIT, 5);
1984 writeBits(writer, HDIST, 5);
1985 writeBits(writer, HCLEN, 4);
1986
1987 /*write the code lengths of the code length alphabet ("bitlen_cl")*/
1988 for(i = 0; i != numcodes_cl; ++i) writeBits(writer, tree_cl.lengths[CLCL_ORDER[i]], 3);
1989
1990 /*write the lengths of the lit/len AND the dist alphabet*/
1991 for(i = 0; i != numcodes_lld_e; ++i) {
1992 writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_cl.codes[bitlen_lld_e[i]], tree_cl.lengths[bitlen_lld_e[i]]);
1993 /*extra bits of repeat codes*/
1994 if(bitlen_lld_e[i] == 16) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 2);
1995 else if(bitlen_lld_e[i] == 17) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 3);
1996 else if(bitlen_lld_e[i] == 18) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 7);
1997 }
1998
1999 /*write the compressed data symbols*/
2000 writeLZ77data(writer, &lz77_encoded, &tree_ll, &tree_d);
2001 /*error: the length of the end code 256 must be larger than 0*/
2002 if(tree_ll.lengths[256] == 0) ERROR_BREAK(64);
2003
2004 /*write the end code*/
2005 writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[256], tree_ll.lengths[256]);
2006
2007 break; /*end of error-while*/
2008 }
2009
2010 /*cleanup*/
2011 uivector_cleanup(&lz77_encoded);
2012 HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
2013 HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
2014 HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_cl);
2015 lodepng_free(frequencies_ll);
2016 lodepng_free(frequencies_d);
2017 lodepng_free(frequencies_cl);
2018 lodepng_free(bitlen_lld);
2019 lodepng_free(bitlen_lld_e);
2020
2021 return error;
2022}
2023
2024static unsigned deflateFixed(LodePNGBitWriter* writer, Hash* hash,
2025 const unsigned char* data,
2026 size_t datapos, size_t dataend,
2027 const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings, unsigned final) {
2028 HuffmanTree tree_ll; /*tree for literal values and length codes*/
2029 HuffmanTree tree_d; /*tree for distance codes*/
2030
2031 unsigned BFINAL = final;
2032 unsigned error = 0;
2033 size_t i;
2034
2035 HuffmanTree_init(&tree_ll);
2036 HuffmanTree_init(&tree_d);
2037
2038 error = generateFixedLitLenTree(&tree_ll);
2039 if(!error) error = generateFixedDistanceTree(&tree_d);
2040
2041 if(!error) {
2042 writeBits(writer, BFINAL, 1);
2043 writeBits(writer, 1, 1); /*first bit of BTYPE*/
2044 writeBits(writer, 0, 1); /*second bit of BTYPE*/
2045
2046 if(settings->use_lz77) /*LZ77 encoded*/ {
2047 uivector lz77_encoded;
2048 uivector_init(&lz77_encoded);
2049 error = encodeLZ77(&lz77_encoded, hash, data, datapos, dataend, settings->windowsize,
2050 settings->minmatch, settings->nicematch, settings->lazymatching);
2051 if(!error) writeLZ77data(writer, &lz77_encoded, &tree_ll, &tree_d);
2052 uivector_cleanup(&lz77_encoded);
2053 } else /*no LZ77, but still will be Huffman compressed*/ {
2054 for(i = datapos; i < dataend; ++i) {
2055 writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[data[i]], tree_ll.lengths[data[i]]);
2056 }
2057 }
2058 /*add END code*/
2059 if(!error) writeBitsReversed(writer,tree_ll.codes[256], tree_ll.lengths[256]);
2060 }
2061
2062 /*cleanup*/
2063 HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
2064 HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
2065
2066 return error;
2067}
2068
2069static unsigned lodepng_deflatev(ucvector* out, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2070 const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2071 unsigned error = 0;
2072 size_t i, blocksize, numdeflateblocks;
2073 Hash hash;
2074 LodePNGBitWriter writer;
2075
2076 LodePNGBitWriter_init(&writer, out);
2077
2078 if(settings->btype > 2) return 61;
2079 else if(settings->btype == 0) return deflateNoCompression(out, in, insize);
2080 else if(settings->btype == 1) blocksize = insize;
2081 else /*if(settings->btype == 2)*/ {
2082 /*on PNGs, deflate blocks of 65-262k seem to give most dense encoding*/
2083 blocksize = insize / 8u + 8;
2084 if(blocksize < 65536) blocksize = 65536;
2085 if(blocksize > 262144) blocksize = 262144;
2086 }
2087
2088 numdeflateblocks = (insize + blocksize - 1) / blocksize;
2089 if(numdeflateblocks == 0) numdeflateblocks = 1;
2090
2091 error = hash_init(&hash, settings->windowsize);
2092
2093 if(!error) {
2094 for(i = 0; i != numdeflateblocks && !error; ++i) {
2095 unsigned final = (i == numdeflateblocks - 1);
2096 size_t start = i * blocksize;
2097 size_t end = start + blocksize;
2098 if(end > insize) end = insize;
2099
2100 if(settings->btype == 1) error = deflateFixed(&writer, &hash, in, start, end, settings, final);
2101 else if(settings->btype == 2) error = deflateDynamic(&writer, &hash, in, start, end, settings, final);
2102 }
2103 }
2104
2105 hash_cleanup(&hash);
2106
2107 return error;
2108}
2109
2110unsigned lodepng_deflate(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
2111 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2112 const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2113 ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2114 unsigned error = lodepng_deflatev(&v, in, insize, settings);
2115 *out = v.data;
2116 *outsize = v.size;
2117 return error;
2118}
2119
2120static unsigned deflate(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
2121 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2122 const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2123 if(settings->custom_deflate) {
2124 unsigned error = settings->custom_deflate(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2125 /*the custom deflate is allowed to have its own error codes, however, we translate it to code 111*/
2126 return error ? 111 : 0;
2127 } else {
2128 return lodepng_deflate(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2129 }
2130}
2131
2132#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2133
2134/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2135/* / Adler32 / */
2136/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2137
2138static unsigned update_adler32(unsigned adler, const unsigned char* data, unsigned len) {
2139 unsigned s1 = adler & 0xffffu;
2140 unsigned s2 = (adler >> 16u) & 0xffffu;
2141
2142 while(len != 0u) {
2143 unsigned i;
2144 /*at least 5552 sums can be done before the sums overflow, saving a lot of module divisions*/
2145 unsigned amount = len > 5552u ? 5552u : len;
2146 len -= amount;
2147 for(i = 0; i != amount; ++i) {
2148 s1 += (*data++);
2149 s2 += s1;
2150 }
2151 s1 %= 65521u;
2152 s2 %= 65521u;
2153 }
2154
2155 return (s2 << 16u) | s1;
2156}
2157
2158/*Return the adler32 of the bytes data[0..len-1]*/
2159static unsigned adler32(const unsigned char* data, unsigned len) {
2160 return update_adler32(1u, data, len);
2161}
2162
2163/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2164/* / Zlib / */
2165/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2166
2167#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2168
2169static unsigned lodepng_zlib_decompressv(ucvector* out,
2170 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2171 const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2172 unsigned error = 0;
2173 unsigned CM, CINFO, FDICT;
2174
2175 if(insize < 2) return 53; /*error, size of zlib data too small*/
2176 /*read information from zlib header*/
2177 if((in[0] * 256 + in[1]) % 31 != 0) {
2178 /*error: 256 * in[0] + in[1] must be a multiple of 31, the FCHECK value is supposed to be made that way*/
2179 return 24;
2180 }
2181
2182 CM = in[0] & 15;
2183 CINFO = (in[0] >> 4) & 15;
2184 /*FCHECK = in[1] & 31;*/ /*FCHECK is already tested above*/
2185 FDICT = (in[1] >> 5) & 1;
2186 /*FLEVEL = (in[1] >> 6) & 3;*/ /*FLEVEL is not used here*/
2187
2188 if(CM != 8 || CINFO > 7) {
2189 /*error: only compression method 8: inflate with sliding window of 32k is supported by the PNG spec*/
2190 return 25;
2191 }
2192 if(FDICT != 0) {
2193 /*error: the specification of PNG says about the zlib stream:
2194 "The additional flags shall not specify a preset dictionary."*/
2195 return 26;
2196 }
2197
2198 error = inflatev(out, in + 2, insize - 2, settings);
2199 if(error) return error;
2200
2201 if(!settings->ignore_adler32) {
2202 unsigned ADLER32 = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[insize - 4]);
2203 unsigned checksum = adler32(out->data, (unsigned)(out->size));
2204 if(checksum != ADLER32) return 58; /*error, adler checksum not correct, data must be corrupted*/
2205 }
2206
2207 return 0; /*no error*/
2208}
2209
2210
2211unsigned lodepng_zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2212 size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2213 ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2214 unsigned error = lodepng_zlib_decompressv(&v, in, insize, settings);
2215 *out = v.data;
2216 *outsize = v.size;
2217 return error;
2218}
2219
2220/*expected_size is expected output size, to avoid intermediate allocations. Set to 0 if not known. */
2221static unsigned zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, size_t expected_size,
2222 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2223 unsigned error;
2224 if(settings->custom_zlib) {
2225 error = settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2226 if(error) {
2227 /*the custom zlib is allowed to have its own error codes, however, we translate it to code 110*/
2228 error = 110;
2229 /*if there's a max output size, and the custom zlib returned error, then indicate that error instead*/
2230 if(settings->max_output_size && *outsize > settings->max_output_size) error = 109;
2231 }
2232 } else {
2233 ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2234 if(expected_size) {
2235 /*reserve the memory to avoid intermediate reallocations*/
2236 ucvector_resize(&v, *outsize + expected_size);
2237 v.size = *outsize;
2238 }
2239 error = lodepng_zlib_decompressv(&v, in, insize, settings);
2240 *out = v.data;
2241 *outsize = v.size;
2242 }
2243 return error;
2244}
2245
2246#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2247
2248#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2249
2250unsigned lodepng_zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2251 size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2252 size_t i;
2253 unsigned error;
2254 unsigned char* deflatedata = 0;
2255 size_t deflatesize = 0;
2256
2257 error = deflate(&deflatedata, &deflatesize, in, insize, settings);
2258
2259 *out = NULL;
2260 *outsize = 0;
2261 if(!error) {
2262 *outsize = deflatesize + 6;
2263 *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
2264 if(!*out) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
2265 }
2266
2267 if(!error) {
2268 unsigned ADLER32 = adler32(in, (unsigned)insize);
2269 /*zlib data: 1 byte CMF (CM+CINFO), 1 byte FLG, deflate data, 4 byte ADLER32 checksum of the Decompressed data*/
2270 unsigned CMF = 120; /*0b01111000: CM 8, CINFO 7. With CINFO 7, any window size up to 32768 can be used.*/
2271 unsigned FLEVEL = 0;
2272 unsigned FDICT = 0;
2273 unsigned CMFFLG = 256 * CMF + FDICT * 32 + FLEVEL * 64;
2274 unsigned FCHECK = 31 - CMFFLG % 31;
2275 CMFFLG += FCHECK;
2276
2277 (*out)[0] = (unsigned char)(CMFFLG >> 8);
2278 (*out)[1] = (unsigned char)(CMFFLG & 255);
2279 for(i = 0; i != deflatesize; ++i) (*out)[i + 2] = deflatedata[i];
2280 lodepng_set32bitInt(&(*out)[*outsize - 4], ADLER32);
2281 }
2282
2283 lodepng_free(deflatedata);
2284 return error;
2285}
2286
2287/* compress using the default or custom zlib function */
2288static unsigned zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2289 size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2290 if(settings->custom_zlib) {
2291 unsigned error = settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2292 /*the custom zlib is allowed to have its own error codes, however, we translate it to code 111*/
2293 return error ? 111 : 0;
2294 } else {
2295 return lodepng_zlib_compress(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2296 }
2297}
2298
2299#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2300
2301#else /*no LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB*/
2302
2303#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2304static unsigned zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, size_t expected_size,
2305 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2306 if(!settings->custom_zlib) return 87; /*no custom zlib function provided */
2307 (void)expected_size;
2308 return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2309}
2310#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2311#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2312static unsigned zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2313 size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2314 if(!settings->custom_zlib) return 87; /*no custom zlib function provided */
2315 return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2316}
2317#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2318
2319#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB*/
2320
2321/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2322
2323#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2324
2325/*this is a good tradeoff between speed and compression ratio*/
2326#define DEFAULT_WINDOWSIZE 2048
2327
2328void lodepng_compress_settings_init(LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2329 /*compress with dynamic huffman tree (not in the mathematical sense, just not the predefined one)*/
2330 settings->btype = 2;
2331 settings->use_lz77 = 1;
2332 settings->windowsize = DEFAULT_WINDOWSIZE;
2333 settings->minmatch = 3;
2334 settings->nicematch = 128;
2335 settings->lazymatching = 1;
2336
2337 settings->custom_zlib = 0;
2338 settings->custom_deflate = 0;
2339 settings->custom_context = 0;
2340}
2341
2342const LodePNGCompressSettings lodepng_default_compress_settings = {2, 1, DEFAULT_WINDOWSIZE, 3, 128, 1, 0, 0, 0};
2343
2344
2345#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2346
2347#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2348
2349void lodepng_decompress_settings_init(LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2350 settings->ignore_adler32 = 0;
2351 settings->ignore_nlen = 0;
2352 settings->max_output_size = 0;
2353
2354 settings->custom_zlib = 0;
2355 settings->custom_inflate = 0;
2356 settings->custom_context = 0;
2357}
2358
2359const LodePNGDecompressSettings lodepng_default_decompress_settings = {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
2360
2361#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2362
2363/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2364/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2365/* // End of Zlib related code. Begin of PNG related code. // */
2366/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2367/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2368
2369#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG
2370
2371/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2372/* / CRC32 / */
2373/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2374
2375
2376#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_CRC
2377/* CRC polynomial: 0xedb88320 */
2378static unsigned lodepng_crc32_table[256] = {
2379 0u, 1996959894u, 3993919788u, 2567524794u, 124634137u, 1886057615u, 3915621685u, 2657392035u,
2380 249268274u, 2044508324u, 3772115230u, 2547177864u, 162941995u, 2125561021u, 3887607047u, 2428444049u,
2381 498536548u, 1789927666u, 4089016648u, 2227061214u, 450548861u, 1843258603u, 4107580753u, 2211677639u,
2382 325883990u, 1684777152u, 4251122042u, 2321926636u, 335633487u, 1661365465u, 4195302755u, 2366115317u,
2383 997073096u, 1281953886u, 3579855332u, 2724688242u, 1006888145u, 1258607687u, 3524101629u, 2768942443u,
2384 901097722u, 1119000684u, 3686517206u, 2898065728u, 853044451u, 1172266101u, 3705015759u, 2882616665u,
2385 651767980u, 1373503546u, 3369554304u, 3218104598u, 565507253u, 1454621731u, 3485111705u, 3099436303u,
2386 671266974u, 1594198024u, 3322730930u, 2970347812u, 795835527u, 1483230225u, 3244367275u, 3060149565u,
2387 1994146192u, 31158534u, 2563907772u, 4023717930u, 1907459465u, 112637215u, 2680153253u, 3904427059u,
2388 2013776290u, 251722036u, 2517215374u, 3775830040u, 2137656763u, 141376813u, 2439277719u, 3865271297u,
2389 1802195444u, 476864866u, 2238001368u, 4066508878u, 1812370925u, 453092731u, 2181625025u, 4111451223u,
2390 1706088902u, 314042704u, 2344532202u, 4240017532u, 1658658271u, 366619977u, 2362670323u, 4224994405u,
2391 1303535960u, 984961486u, 2747007092u, 3569037538u, 1256170817u, 1037604311u, 2765210733u, 3554079995u,
2392 1131014506u, 879679996u, 2909243462u, 3663771856u, 1141124467u, 855842277u, 2852801631u, 3708648649u,
2393 1342533948u, 654459306u, 3188396048u, 3373015174u, 1466479909u, 544179635u, 3110523913u, 3462522015u,
2394 1591671054u, 702138776u, 2966460450u, 3352799412u, 1504918807u, 783551873u, 3082640443u, 3233442989u,
2395 3988292384u, 2596254646u, 62317068u, 1957810842u, 3939845945u, 2647816111u, 81470997u, 1943803523u,
2396 3814918930u, 2489596804u, 225274430u, 2053790376u, 3826175755u, 2466906013u, 167816743u, 2097651377u,
2397 4027552580u, 2265490386u, 503444072u, 1762050814u, 4150417245u, 2154129355u, 426522225u, 1852507879u,
2398 4275313526u, 2312317920u, 282753626u, 1742555852u, 4189708143u, 2394877945u, 397917763u, 1622183637u,
2399 3604390888u, 2714866558u, 953729732u, 1340076626u, 3518719985u, 2797360999u, 1068828381u, 1219638859u,
2400 3624741850u, 2936675148u, 906185462u, 1090812512u, 3747672003u, 2825379669u, 829329135u, 1181335161u,
2401 3412177804u, 3160834842u, 628085408u, 1382605366u, 3423369109u, 3138078467u, 570562233u, 1426400815u,
2402 3317316542u, 2998733608u, 733239954u, 1555261956u, 3268935591u, 3050360625u, 752459403u, 1541320221u,
2403 2607071920u, 3965973030u, 1969922972u, 40735498u, 2617837225u, 3943577151u, 1913087877u, 83908371u,
2404 2512341634u, 3803740692u, 2075208622u, 213261112u, 2463272603u, 3855990285u, 2094854071u, 198958881u,
2405 2262029012u, 4057260610u, 1759359992u, 534414190u, 2176718541u, 4139329115u, 1873836001u, 414664567u,
2406 2282248934u, 4279200368u, 1711684554u, 285281116u, 2405801727u, 4167216745u, 1634467795u, 376229701u,
2407 2685067896u, 3608007406u, 1308918612u, 956543938u, 2808555105u, 3495958263u, 1231636301u, 1047427035u,
2408 2932959818u, 3654703836u, 1088359270u, 936918000u, 2847714899u, 3736837829u, 1202900863u, 817233897u,
2409 3183342108u, 3401237130u, 1404277552u, 615818150u, 3134207493u, 3453421203u, 1423857449u, 601450431u,
2410 3009837614u, 3294710456u, 1567103746u, 711928724u, 3020668471u, 3272380065u, 1510334235u, 755167117u
2411};
2412
2413/*Return the CRC of the bytes buf[0..len-1].*/
2414unsigned lodepng_crc32(const unsigned char* data, size_t length) {
2415 unsigned r = 0xffffffffu;
2416 size_t i;
2417 for(i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
2418 r = lodepng_crc32_table[(r ^ data[i]) & 0xffu] ^ (r >> 8u);
2419 }
2420 return r ^ 0xffffffffu;
2421}
2422#else /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_CRC */
2423/*in this case, the function is only declared here, and must be defined externally
2424so that it will be linked in*/
2425unsigned lodepng_crc32(const unsigned char* data, size_t length);
2426#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_CRC */
2427
2428/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2429/* / Reading and writing PNG color channel bits / */
2430/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2431
2432/* The color channel bits of less-than-8-bit pixels are read with the MSB of bytes first,
2433so LodePNGBitWriter and LodePNGBitReader can't be used for those. */
2434
2435static unsigned char readBitFromReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, const unsigned char* bitstream) {
2436 unsigned char result = (unsigned char)((bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3] >> (7 - ((*bitpointer) & 0x7))) & 1);
2437 ++(*bitpointer);
2438 return result;
2439}
2440
2441/* TODO: make this faster */
2442static unsigned readBitsFromReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, const unsigned char* bitstream, size_t nbits) {
2443 unsigned result = 0;
2444 size_t i;
2445 for(i = 0 ; i < nbits; ++i) {
2446 result <<= 1u;
2447 result |= (unsigned)readBitFromReversedStream(bitpointer, bitstream);
2448 }
2449 return result;
2450}
2451
2452static void setBitOfReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, unsigned char* bitstream, unsigned char bit) {
2453 /*the current bit in bitstream may be 0 or 1 for this to work*/
2454 if(bit == 0) bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3u] &= (unsigned char)(~(1u << (7u - ((*bitpointer) & 7u))));
2455 else bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3u] |= (1u << (7u - ((*bitpointer) & 7u)));
2456 ++(*bitpointer);
2457}
2458
2459/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2460/* / PNG chunks / */
2461/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2462
2463unsigned lodepng_chunk_length(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2464 return lodepng_read32bitInt(chunk);
2465}
2466
2467void lodepng_chunk_type(char type[5], const unsigned char* chunk) {
2468 unsigned i;
2469 for(i = 0; i != 4; ++i) type[i] = (char)chunk[4 + i];
2470 type[4] = 0; /*null termination char*/
2471}
2472
2473unsigned char lodepng_chunk_type_equals(const unsigned char* chunk, const char* type) {
2474 if(lodepng_strlen(type) != 4) return 0;
2475 return (chunk[4] == type[0] && chunk[5] == type[1] && chunk[6] == type[2] && chunk[7] == type[3]);
2476}
2477
2478unsigned char lodepng_chunk_ancillary(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2479 return((chunk[4] & 32) != 0);
2480}
2481
2482unsigned char lodepng_chunk_private(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2483 return((chunk[6] & 32) != 0);
2484}
2485
2486unsigned char lodepng_chunk_safetocopy(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2487 return((chunk[7] & 32) != 0);
2488}
2489
2490unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_data(unsigned char* chunk) {
2491 return &chunk[8];
2492}
2493
2494const unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_data_const(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2495 return &chunk[8];
2496}
2497
2498unsigned lodepng_chunk_check_crc(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2499 unsigned length = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
2500 unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&chunk[length + 8]);
2501 /*the CRC is taken of the data and the 4 chunk type letters, not the length*/
2502 unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&chunk[4], length + 4);
2503 if(CRC != checksum) return 1;
2504 else return 0;
2505}
2506
2507void lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(unsigned char* chunk) {
2508 unsigned length = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
2509 unsigned CRC = lodepng_crc32(&chunk[4], length + 4);
2510 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8 + length, CRC);
2511}
2512
2513unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_next(unsigned char* chunk, unsigned char* end) {
2514 size_t available_size = (size_t)(end - chunk);
2515 if(chunk >= end || available_size < 12) return end; /*too small to contain a chunk*/
2516 if(chunk[0] == 0x89 && chunk[1] == 0x50 && chunk[2] == 0x4e && chunk[3] == 0x47
2517 && chunk[4] == 0x0d && chunk[5] == 0x0a && chunk[6] == 0x1a && chunk[7] == 0x0a) {
2518 /* Is PNG magic header at start of PNG file. Jump to first actual chunk. */
2519 return chunk + 8;
2520 } else {
2521 size_t total_chunk_length;
2522 if(lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return end;
2523 if(total_chunk_length > available_size) return end; /*outside of range*/
2524 return chunk + total_chunk_length;
2525 }
2526}
2527
2528const unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_next_const(const unsigned char* chunk, const unsigned char* end) {
2529 size_t available_size = (size_t)(end - chunk);
2530 if(chunk >= end || available_size < 12) return end; /*too small to contain a chunk*/
2531 if(chunk[0] == 0x89 && chunk[1] == 0x50 && chunk[2] == 0x4e && chunk[3] == 0x47
2532 && chunk[4] == 0x0d && chunk[5] == 0x0a && chunk[6] == 0x1a && chunk[7] == 0x0a) {
2533 /* Is PNG magic header at start of PNG file. Jump to first actual chunk. */
2534 return chunk + 8;
2535 } else {
2536 size_t total_chunk_length;
2537 if(lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return end;
2538 if(total_chunk_length > available_size) return end; /*outside of range*/
2539 return chunk + total_chunk_length;
2540 }
2541}
2542
2543unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_find(unsigned char* chunk, unsigned char* end, const char type[5]) {
2544 for(;;) {
2545 if(chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return 0; /* past file end: chunk + 12 > end */
2546 if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, type)) return chunk;
2547 chunk = lodepng_chunk_next(chunk, end);
2548 }
2549}
2550
2551const unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_find_const(const unsigned char* chunk, const unsigned char* end, const char type[5]) {
2552 for(;;) {
2553 if(chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return 0; /* past file end: chunk + 12 > end */
2554 if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, type)) return chunk;
2555 chunk = lodepng_chunk_next_const(chunk, end);
2556 }
2557}
2558
2559unsigned lodepng_chunk_append(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* chunk) {
2560 unsigned i;
2561 size_t total_chunk_length, new_length;
2562 unsigned char *chunk_start, *new_buffer;
2563
2564 if(lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return 77;
2565 if(lodepng_addofl(*outsize, total_chunk_length, &new_length)) return 77;
2566
2567 new_buffer = (unsigned char*)lodepng_realloc(*out, new_length);
2568 if(!new_buffer) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2569 (*out) = new_buffer;
2570 (*outsize) = new_length;
2571 chunk_start = &(*out)[new_length - total_chunk_length];
2572
2573 for(i = 0; i != total_chunk_length; ++i) chunk_start[i] = chunk[i];
2574
2575 return 0;
2576}
2577
2578/*Sets length and name and allocates the space for data and crc but does not
2579set data or crc yet. Returns the start of the chunk in chunk. The start of
2580the data is at chunk + 8. To finalize chunk, add the data, then use
2581lodepng_chunk_generate_crc */
2582static unsigned lodepng_chunk_init(unsigned char** chunk,
2583 ucvector* out,
2584 unsigned length, const char* type) {
2585 size_t new_length = out->size;
2586 if(lodepng_addofl(new_length, length, &new_length)) return 77;
2587 if(lodepng_addofl(new_length, 12, &new_length)) return 77;
2588 if(!ucvector_resize(out, new_length)) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2589 *chunk = out->data + new_length - length - 12u;
2590
2591 /*1: length*/
2592 lodepng_set32bitInt(*chunk, length);
2593
2594 /*2: chunk name (4 letters)*/
2595 lodepng_memcpy(*chunk + 4, type, 4);
2596
2597 return 0;
2598}
2599
2600/* like lodepng_chunk_create but with custom allocsize */
2601static unsigned lodepng_chunk_createv(ucvector* out,
2602 unsigned length, const char* type, const unsigned char* data) {
2603 unsigned char* chunk;
2604 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, length, type));
2605
2606 /*3: the data*/
2607 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, data, length);
2608
2609 /*4: CRC (of the chunkname characters and the data)*/
2610 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
2611
2612 return 0;
2613}
2614
2615unsigned lodepng_chunk_create(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
2616 unsigned length, const char* type, const unsigned char* data) {
2617 ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2618 unsigned error = lodepng_chunk_createv(&v, length, type, data);
2619 *out = v.data;
2620 *outsize = v.size;
2621 return error;
2622}
2623
2624/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2625/* / Color types, channels, bits / */
2626/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2627
2628/*checks if the colortype is valid and the bitdepth bd is allowed for this colortype.
2629Return value is a LodePNG error code.*/
2630static unsigned checkColorValidity(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bd) {
2631 switch(colortype) {
2632 case LCT_GREY: if(!(bd == 1 || bd == 2 || bd == 4 || bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2633 case LCT_RGB: if(!( bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2634 case LCT_PALETTE: if(!(bd == 1 || bd == 2 || bd == 4 || bd == 8 )) return 37; break;
2635 case LCT_GREY_ALPHA: if(!( bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2636 case LCT_RGBA: if(!( bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2637 case LCT_MAX_OCTET_VALUE: return 31; /* invalid color type */
2638 default: return 31; /* invalid color type */
2639 }
2640 return 0; /*allowed color type / bits combination*/
2641}
2642
2643static unsigned getNumColorChannels(LodePNGColorType colortype) {
2644 switch(colortype) {
2645 case LCT_GREY: return 1;
2646 case LCT_RGB: return 3;
2647 case LCT_PALETTE: return 1;
2648 case LCT_GREY_ALPHA: return 2;
2649 case LCT_RGBA: return 4;
2650 case LCT_MAX_OCTET_VALUE: return 0; /* invalid color type */
2651 default: return 0; /*invalid color type*/
2652 }
2653}
2654
2655static unsigned lodepng_get_bpp_lct(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
2656 /*bits per pixel is amount of channels * bits per channel*/
2657 return getNumColorChannels(colortype) * bitdepth;
2658}
2659
2660/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2661
2662void lodepng_color_mode_init(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2663 info->key_defined = 0;
2664 info->key_r = info->key_g = info->key_b = 0;
2665 info->colortype = LCT_RGBA;
2666 info->bitdepth = 8;
2667 info->palette = 0;
2668 info->palettesize = 0;
2669}
2670
2671/*allocates palette memory if needed, and initializes all colors to black*/
2672static void lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2673 size_t i;
2674 /*if the palette is already allocated, it will have size 1024 so no reallocation needed in that case*/
2675 /*the palette must have room for up to 256 colors with 4 bytes each.*/
2676 if(!info->palette) info->palette = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(1024);
2677 if(!info->palette) return; /*alloc fail*/
2678 for(i = 0; i != 256; ++i) {
2679 /*Initialize all unused colors with black, the value used for invalid palette indices.
2680 This is an error according to the PNG spec, but common PNG decoders make it black instead.
2681 That makes color conversion slightly faster due to no error handling needed.*/
2682 info->palette[i * 4 + 0] = 0;
2683 info->palette[i * 4 + 1] = 0;
2684 info->palette[i * 4 + 2] = 0;
2685 info->palette[i * 4 + 3] = 255;
2686 }
2687}
2688
2689void lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2690 lodepng_palette_clear(info);
2691}
2692
2693unsigned lodepng_color_mode_copy(LodePNGColorMode* dest, const LodePNGColorMode* source) {
2694 lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(dest);
2695 lodepng_memcpy(dest, source, sizeof(LodePNGColorMode));
2696 if(source->palette) {
2697 dest->palette = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(1024);
2698 if(!dest->palette && source->palettesize) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2699 lodepng_memcpy(dest->palette, source->palette, source->palettesize * 4);
2700 }
2701 return 0;
2702}
2703
2704LodePNGColorMode lodepng_color_mode_make(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
2705 LodePNGColorMode result;
2706 lodepng_color_mode_init(&result);
2707 result.colortype = colortype;
2708 result.bitdepth = bitdepth;
2709 return result;
2710}
2711
2712static int lodepng_color_mode_equal(const LodePNGColorMode* a, const LodePNGColorMode* b) {
2713 size_t i;
2714 if(a->colortype != b->colortype) return 0;
2715 if(a->bitdepth != b->bitdepth) return 0;
2716 if(a->key_defined != b->key_defined) return 0;
2717 if(a->key_defined) {
2718 if(a->key_r != b->key_r) return 0;
2719 if(a->key_g != b->key_g) return 0;
2720 if(a->key_b != b->key_b) return 0;
2721 }
2722 if(a->palettesize != b->palettesize) return 0;
2723 for(i = 0; i != a->palettesize * 4; ++i) {
2724 if(a->palette[i] != b->palette[i]) return 0;
2725 }
2726 return 1;
2727}
2728
2729void lodepng_palette_clear(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2730 if(info->palette) lodepng_free(info->palette);
2731 info->palette = 0;
2732 info->palettesize = 0;
2733}
2734
2735unsigned lodepng_palette_add(LodePNGColorMode* info,
2736 unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
2737 if(!info->palette) /*allocate palette if empty*/ {
2738 lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette(info);
2739 if(!info->palette) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2740 }
2741 if(info->palettesize >= 256) {
2742 return 108; /*too many palette values*/
2743 }
2744 info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 0] = r;
2745 info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 1] = g;
2746 info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 2] = b;
2747 info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 3] = a;
2748 ++info->palettesize;
2749 return 0;
2750}
2751
2752/*calculate bits per pixel out of colortype and bitdepth*/
2753unsigned lodepng_get_bpp(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2754 return lodepng_get_bpp_lct(info->colortype, info->bitdepth);
2755}
2756
2757unsigned lodepng_get_channels(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2758 return getNumColorChannels(info->colortype);
2759}
2760
2761unsigned lodepng_is_greyscale_type(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2762 return info->colortype == LCT_GREY || info->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA;
2763}
2764
2765unsigned lodepng_is_alpha_type(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2766 return (info->colortype & 4) != 0; /*4 or 6*/
2767}
2768
2769unsigned lodepng_is_palette_type(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2770 return info->colortype == LCT_PALETTE;
2771}
2772
2773unsigned lodepng_has_palette_alpha(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2774 size_t i;
2775 for(i = 0; i != info->palettesize; ++i) {
2776 if(info->palette[i * 4 + 3] < 255) return 1;
2777 }
2778 return 0;
2779}
2780
2781unsigned lodepng_can_have_alpha(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2782 return info->key_defined
2783 || lodepng_is_alpha_type(info)
2784 || lodepng_has_palette_alpha(info);
2785}
2786
2787static size_t lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(unsigned w, unsigned h, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
2788 size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp_lct(colortype, bitdepth);
2789 size_t n = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
2790 return ((n / 8u) * bpp) + ((n & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
2791}
2792
2793size_t lodepng_get_raw_size(unsigned w, unsigned h, const LodePNGColorMode* color) {
2794 return lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(w, h, color->colortype, color->bitdepth);
2795}
2796
2797
2798#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG
2799
2800/*in an idat chunk, each scanline is a multiple of 8 bits, unlike the lodepng output buffer,
2801and in addition has one extra byte per line: the filter byte. So this gives a larger
2802result than lodepng_get_raw_size. Set h to 1 to get the size of 1 row including filter byte. */
2803static size_t lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
2804 /* + 1 for the filter byte, and possibly plus padding bits per line. */
2805 /* Ignoring casts, the expression is equal to (w * bpp + 7) / 8 + 1, but avoids overflow of w * bpp */
2806 size_t line = ((size_t)(w / 8u) * bpp) + 1u + ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
2807 return (size_t)h * line;
2808}
2809
2810#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2811/*Safely checks whether size_t overflow can be caused due to amount of pixels.
2812This check is overcautious rather than precise. If this check indicates no overflow,
2813you can safely compute in a size_t (but not an unsigned):
2814-(size_t)w * (size_t)h * 8
2815-amount of bytes in IDAT (including filter, padding and Adam7 bytes)
2816-amount of bytes in raw color model
2817Returns 1 if overflow possible, 0 if not.
2818*/
2819static int lodepng_pixel_overflow(unsigned w, unsigned h,
2820 const LodePNGColorMode* pngcolor, const LodePNGColorMode* rawcolor) {
2821 size_t bpp = LODEPNG_MAX(lodepng_get_bpp(pngcolor), lodepng_get_bpp(rawcolor));
2822 size_t numpixels, total;
2823 size_t line; /* bytes per line in worst case */
2824
2825 if(lodepng_mulofl((size_t)w, (size_t)h, &numpixels)) return 1;
2826 if(lodepng_mulofl(numpixels, 8, &total)) return 1; /* bit pointer with 8-bit color, or 8 bytes per channel color */
2827
2828 /* Bytes per scanline with the expression "(w / 8u) * bpp) + ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u" */
2829 if(lodepng_mulofl((size_t)(w / 8u), bpp, &line)) return 1;
2830 if(lodepng_addofl(line, ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u, &line)) return 1;
2831
2832 if(lodepng_addofl(line, 5, &line)) return 1; /* 5 bytes overhead per line: 1 filterbyte, 4 for Adam7 worst case */
2833 if(lodepng_mulofl(line, h, &total)) return 1; /* Total bytes in worst case */
2834
2835 return 0; /* no overflow */
2836}
2837#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2838#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG*/
2839
2840#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
2841
2842static void LodePNGUnknownChunks_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2843 unsigned i;
2844 for(i = 0; i != 3; ++i) info->unknown_chunks_data[i] = 0;
2845 for(i = 0; i != 3; ++i) info->unknown_chunks_size[i] = 0;
2846}
2847
2848static void LodePNGUnknownChunks_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2849 unsigned i;
2850 for(i = 0; i != 3; ++i) lodepng_free(info->unknown_chunks_data[i]);
2851}
2852
2853static unsigned LodePNGUnknownChunks_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* src) {
2854 unsigned i;
2855
2856 LodePNGUnknownChunks_cleanup(dest);
2857
2858 for(i = 0; i != 3; ++i) {
2859 size_t j;
2860 dest->unknown_chunks_size[i] = src->unknown_chunks_size[i];
2861 dest->unknown_chunks_data[i] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(src->unknown_chunks_size[i]);
2862 if(!dest->unknown_chunks_data[i] && dest->unknown_chunks_size[i]) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2863 for(j = 0; j < src->unknown_chunks_size[i]; ++j) {
2864 dest->unknown_chunks_data[i][j] = src->unknown_chunks_data[i][j];
2865 }
2866 }
2867
2868 return 0;
2869}
2870
2871/******************************************************************************/
2872
2873static void LodePNGText_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2874 info->text_num = 0;
2875 info->text_keys = NULL;
2876 info->text_strings = NULL;
2877}
2878
2879static void LodePNGText_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2880 size_t i;
2881 for(i = 0; i != info->text_num; ++i) {
2882 string_cleanup(&info->text_keys[i]);
2883 string_cleanup(&info->text_strings[i]);
2884 }
2885 lodepng_free(info->text_keys);
2886 lodepng_free(info->text_strings);
2887}
2888
2889static unsigned LodePNGText_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* source) {
2890 size_t i = 0;
2891 dest->text_keys = NULL;
2892 dest->text_strings = NULL;
2893 dest->text_num = 0;
2894 for(i = 0; i != source->text_num; ++i) {
2895 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_add_text(dest, source->text_keys[i], source->text_strings[i]));
2896 }
2897 return 0;
2898}
2899
2900static unsigned lodepng_add_text_sized(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* str, size_t size) {
2901 char** new_keys = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->text_keys, sizeof(char*) * (info->text_num + 1)));
2902 char** new_strings = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->text_strings, sizeof(char*) * (info->text_num + 1)));
2903
2904 if(new_keys) info->text_keys = new_keys;
2905 if(new_strings) info->text_strings = new_strings;
2906
2907 if(!new_keys || !new_strings) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2908
2909 ++info->text_num;
2910 info->text_keys[info->text_num - 1] = alloc_string(key);
2911 info->text_strings[info->text_num - 1] = alloc_string_sized(str, size);
2912 if(!info->text_keys[info->text_num - 1] || !info->text_strings[info->text_num - 1]) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2913
2914 return 0;
2915}
2916
2917unsigned lodepng_add_text(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* str) {
2918 return lodepng_add_text_sized(info, key, str, lodepng_strlen(str));
2919}
2920
2921void lodepng_clear_text(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2922 LodePNGText_cleanup(info);
2923}
2924
2925/******************************************************************************/
2926
2927static void LodePNGIText_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2928 info->itext_num = 0;
2929 info->itext_keys = NULL;
2930 info->itext_langtags = NULL;
2931 info->itext_transkeys = NULL;
2932 info->itext_strings = NULL;
2933}
2934
2935static void LodePNGIText_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2936 size_t i;
2937 for(i = 0; i != info->itext_num; ++i) {
2938 string_cleanup(&info->itext_keys[i]);
2939 string_cleanup(&info->itext_langtags[i]);
2940 string_cleanup(&info->itext_transkeys[i]);
2941 string_cleanup(&info->itext_strings[i]);
2942 }
2943 lodepng_free(info->itext_keys);
2944 lodepng_free(info->itext_langtags);
2945 lodepng_free(info->itext_transkeys);
2946 lodepng_free(info->itext_strings);
2947}
2948
2949static unsigned LodePNGIText_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* source) {
2950 size_t i = 0;
2951 dest->itext_keys = NULL;
2952 dest->itext_langtags = NULL;
2953 dest->itext_transkeys = NULL;
2954 dest->itext_strings = NULL;
2955 dest->itext_num = 0;
2956 for(i = 0; i != source->itext_num; ++i) {
2957 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_add_itext(dest, source->itext_keys[i], source->itext_langtags[i],
2958 source->itext_transkeys[i], source->itext_strings[i]));
2959 }
2960 return 0;
2961}
2962
2963void lodepng_clear_itext(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2964 LodePNGIText_cleanup(info);
2965}
2966
2967static unsigned lodepng_add_itext_sized(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* langtag,
2968 const char* transkey, const char* str, size_t size) {
2969 char** new_keys = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_keys, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2970 char** new_langtags = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_langtags, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2971 char** new_transkeys = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_transkeys, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2972 char** new_strings = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_strings, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2973
2974 if(new_keys) info->itext_keys = new_keys;
2975 if(new_langtags) info->itext_langtags = new_langtags;
2976 if(new_transkeys) info->itext_transkeys = new_transkeys;
2977 if(new_strings) info->itext_strings = new_strings;
2978
2979 if(!new_keys || !new_langtags || !new_transkeys || !new_strings) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2980
2981 ++info->itext_num;
2982
2983 info->itext_keys[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string(key);
2984 info->itext_langtags[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string(langtag);
2985 info->itext_transkeys[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string(transkey);
2986 info->itext_strings[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string_sized(str, size);
2987
2988 return 0;
2989}
2990
2991unsigned lodepng_add_itext(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* langtag,
2992 const char* transkey, const char* str) {
2993 return lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, str, lodepng_strlen(str));
2994}
2995
2996/* same as set but does not delete */
2997static unsigned lodepng_assign_icc(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* name, const unsigned char* profile, unsigned profile_size) {
2998 if(profile_size == 0) return 100; /*invalid ICC profile size*/
2999
3000 info->iccp_name = alloc_string(name);
3001 info->iccp_profile = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(profile_size);
3002
3003 if(!info->iccp_name || !info->iccp_profile) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
3004
3005 lodepng_memcpy(info->iccp_profile, profile, profile_size);
3006 info->iccp_profile_size = profile_size;
3007
3008 return 0; /*ok*/
3009}
3010
3011unsigned lodepng_set_icc(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* name, const unsigned char* profile, unsigned profile_size) {
3012 if(info->iccp_name) lodepng_clear_icc(info);
3013 info->iccp_defined = 1;
3014
3015 return lodepng_assign_icc(info, name, profile, profile_size);
3016}
3017
3018void lodepng_clear_icc(LodePNGInfo* info) {
3019 string_cleanup(&info->iccp_name);
3020 lodepng_free(info->iccp_profile);
3021 info->iccp_profile = NULL;
3022 info->iccp_profile_size = 0;
3023 info->iccp_defined = 0;
3024}
3025#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3026
3027void lodepng_info_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
3028 lodepng_color_mode_init(&info->color);
3029 info->interlace_method = 0;
3030 info->compression_method = 0;
3031 info->filter_method = 0;
3032#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3033 info->background_defined = 0;
3034 info->background_r = info->background_g = info->background_b = 0;
3035
3036 LodePNGText_init(info);
3037 LodePNGIText_init(info);
3038
3039 info->time_defined = 0;
3040 info->phys_defined = 0;
3041
3042 info->gama_defined = 0;
3043 info->chrm_defined = 0;
3044 info->srgb_defined = 0;
3045 info->iccp_defined = 0;
3046 info->iccp_name = NULL;
3047 info->iccp_profile = NULL;
3048
3049 info->sbit_defined = 0;
3050 info->sbit_r = info->sbit_g = info->sbit_b = info->sbit_a = 0;
3051
3052 LodePNGUnknownChunks_init(info);
3053#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3054}
3055
3056void lodepng_info_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
3057 lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&info->color);
3058#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3059 LodePNGText_cleanup(info);
3060 LodePNGIText_cleanup(info);
3061
3062 lodepng_clear_icc(info);
3063
3064 LodePNGUnknownChunks_cleanup(info);
3065#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3066}
3067
3068unsigned lodepng_info_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* source) {
3069 lodepng_info_cleanup(dest);
3070 lodepng_memcpy(dest, source, sizeof(LodePNGInfo));
3071 lodepng_color_mode_init(&dest->color);
3072 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_color_mode_copy(&dest->color, &source->color));
3073
3074#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3075 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(LodePNGText_copy(dest, source));
3076 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(LodePNGIText_copy(dest, source));
3077 if(source->iccp_defined) {
3078 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_assign_icc(dest, source->iccp_name, source->iccp_profile, source->iccp_profile_size));
3079 }
3080
3081 LodePNGUnknownChunks_init(dest);
3082 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(LodePNGUnknownChunks_copy(dest, source));
3083#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3084 return 0;
3085}
3086
3087/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
3088
3089/*index: bitgroup index, bits: bitgroup size(1, 2 or 4), in: bitgroup value, out: octet array to add bits to*/
3090static void addColorBits(unsigned char* out, size_t index, unsigned bits, unsigned in) {
3091 unsigned m = bits == 1 ? 7 : bits == 2 ? 3 : 1; /*8 / bits - 1*/
3092 /*p = the partial index in the byte, e.g. with 4 palettebits it is 0 for first half or 1 for second half*/
3093 unsigned p = index & m;
3094 in &= (1u << bits) - 1u; /*filter out any other bits of the input value*/
3095 in = in << (bits * (m - p));
3096 if(p == 0) out[index * bits / 8u] = in;
3097 else out[index * bits / 8u] |= in;
3098}
3099
3100typedef struct ColorTree ColorTree;
3101
3102/*
3103One node of a color tree
3104This is the data structure used to count the number of unique colors and to get a palette
3105index for a color. It's like an octree, but because the alpha channel is used too, each
3106node has 16 instead of 8 children.
3107*/
3108struct ColorTree {
3109 ColorTree* children[16]; /*up to 16 pointers to ColorTree of next level*/
3110 int index; /*the payload. Only has a meaningful value if this is in the last level*/
3111};
3112
3113static void color_tree_init(ColorTree* tree) {
3114 lodepng_memset(tree->children, 0, 16 * sizeof(*tree->children));
3115 tree->index = -1;
3116}
3117
3118static void color_tree_cleanup(ColorTree* tree) {
3119 int i;
3120 for(i = 0; i != 16; ++i) {
3121 if(tree->children[i]) {
3122 color_tree_cleanup(tree->children[i]);
3123 lodepng_free(tree->children[i]);
3124 }
3125 }
3126}
3127
3128/*returns -1 if color not present, its index otherwise*/
3129static int color_tree_get(ColorTree* tree, unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
3130 int bit = 0;
3131 for(bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit) {
3132 int i = 8 * ((r >> bit) & 1) + 4 * ((g >> bit) & 1) + 2 * ((b >> bit) & 1) + 1 * ((a >> bit) & 1);
3133 if(!tree->children[i]) return -1;
3134 else tree = tree->children[i];
3135 }
3136 return tree ? tree->index : -1;
3137}
3138
3139#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
3140static int color_tree_has(ColorTree* tree, unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
3141 return color_tree_get(tree, r, g, b, a) >= 0;
3142}
3143#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
3144
3145/*color is not allowed to already exist.
3146Index should be >= 0 (it's signed to be compatible with using -1 for "doesn't exist")
3147Returns error code, or 0 if ok*/
3148static unsigned color_tree_add(ColorTree* tree,
3149 unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a, unsigned index) {
3150 int bit;
3151 for(bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit) {
3152 int i = 8 * ((r >> bit) & 1) + 4 * ((g >> bit) & 1) + 2 * ((b >> bit) & 1) + 1 * ((a >> bit) & 1);
3153 if(!tree->children[i]) {
3154 tree->children[i] = (ColorTree*)lodepng_malloc(sizeof(ColorTree));
3155 if(!tree->children[i]) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
3156 color_tree_init(tree->children[i]);
3157 }
3158 tree = tree->children[i];
3159 }
3160 tree->index = (int)index;
3161 return 0;
3162}
3163
3164/*put a pixel, given its RGBA color, into image of any color type*/
3165static unsigned rgba8ToPixel(unsigned char* out, size_t i,
3166 const LodePNGColorMode* mode, ColorTree* tree /*for palette*/,
3167 unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
3168 if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3169 unsigned char gray = r; /*((unsigned short)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3170 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) out[i] = gray;
3171 else if(mode->bitdepth == 16) out[i * 2 + 0] = out[i * 2 + 1] = gray;
3172 else {
3173 /*take the most significant bits of gray*/
3174 gray = ((unsigned)gray >> (8u - mode->bitdepth)) & ((1u << mode->bitdepth) - 1u);
3175 addColorBits(out, i, mode->bitdepth, gray);
3176 }
3177 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3178 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3179 out[i * 3 + 0] = r;
3180 out[i * 3 + 1] = g;
3181 out[i * 3 + 2] = b;
3182 } else {
3183 out[i * 6 + 0] = out[i * 6 + 1] = r;
3184 out[i * 6 + 2] = out[i * 6 + 3] = g;
3185 out[i * 6 + 4] = out[i * 6 + 5] = b;
3186 }
3187 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3188 int index = color_tree_get(tree, r, g, b, a);
3189 if(index < 0) return 82; /*color not in palette*/
3190 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) out[i] = index;
3191 else addColorBits(out, i, mode->bitdepth, (unsigned)index);
3192 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3193 unsigned char gray = r; /*((unsigned short)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3194 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3195 out[i * 2 + 0] = gray;
3196 out[i * 2 + 1] = a;
3197 } else if(mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3198 out[i * 4 + 0] = out[i * 4 + 1] = gray;
3199 out[i * 4 + 2] = out[i * 4 + 3] = a;
3200 }
3201 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3202 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3203 out[i * 4 + 0] = r;
3204 out[i * 4 + 1] = g;
3205 out[i * 4 + 2] = b;
3206 out[i * 4 + 3] = a;
3207 } else {
3208 out[i * 8 + 0] = out[i * 8 + 1] = r;
3209 out[i * 8 + 2] = out[i * 8 + 3] = g;
3210 out[i * 8 + 4] = out[i * 8 + 5] = b;
3211 out[i * 8 + 6] = out[i * 8 + 7] = a;
3212 }
3213 }
3214
3215 return 0; /*no error*/
3216}
3217
3218/*put a pixel, given its RGBA16 color, into image of any color 16-bitdepth type*/
3219static void rgba16ToPixel(unsigned char* out, size_t i,
3220 const LodePNGColorMode* mode,
3221 unsigned short r, unsigned short g, unsigned short b, unsigned short a) {
3222 if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3223 unsigned short gray = r; /*((unsigned)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3224 out[i * 2 + 0] = (gray >> 8) & 255;
3225 out[i * 2 + 1] = gray & 255;
3226 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3227 out[i * 6 + 0] = (r >> 8) & 255;
3228 out[i * 6 + 1] = r & 255;
3229 out[i * 6 + 2] = (g >> 8) & 255;
3230 out[i * 6 + 3] = g & 255;
3231 out[i * 6 + 4] = (b >> 8) & 255;
3232 out[i * 6 + 5] = b & 255;
3233 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3234 unsigned short gray = r; /*((unsigned)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3235 out[i * 4 + 0] = (gray >> 8) & 255;
3236 out[i * 4 + 1] = gray & 255;
3237 out[i * 4 + 2] = (a >> 8) & 255;
3238 out[i * 4 + 3] = a & 255;
3239 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3240 out[i * 8 + 0] = (r >> 8) & 255;
3241 out[i * 8 + 1] = r & 255;
3242 out[i * 8 + 2] = (g >> 8) & 255;
3243 out[i * 8 + 3] = g & 255;
3244 out[i * 8 + 4] = (b >> 8) & 255;
3245 out[i * 8 + 5] = b & 255;
3246 out[i * 8 + 6] = (a >> 8) & 255;
3247 out[i * 8 + 7] = a & 255;
3248 }
3249}
3250
3251/*Get RGBA8 color of pixel with index i (y * width + x) from the raw image with given color type.*/
3252static void getPixelColorRGBA8(unsigned char* r, unsigned char* g,
3253 unsigned char* b, unsigned char* a,
3254 const unsigned char* in, size_t i,
3255 const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3256 if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3257 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3258 *r = *g = *b = in[i];
3259 if(mode->key_defined && *r == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3260 else *a = 255;
3261 } else if(mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3262 *r = *g = *b = in[i * 2 + 0];
3263 if(mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3264 else *a = 255;
3265 } else {
3266 unsigned highest = ((1U << mode->bitdepth) - 1U); /*highest possible value for this bit depth*/
3267 size_t j = i * mode->bitdepth;
3268 unsigned value = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3269 *r = *g = *b = (value * 255) / highest;
3270 if(mode->key_defined && value == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3271 else *a = 255;
3272 }
3273 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3274 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3275 *r = in[i * 3 + 0]; *g = in[i * 3 + 1]; *b = in[i * 3 + 2];
3276 if(mode->key_defined && *r == mode->key_r && *g == mode->key_g && *b == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3277 else *a = 255;
3278 } else {
3279 *r = in[i * 6 + 0];
3280 *g = in[i * 6 + 2];
3281 *b = in[i * 6 + 4];
3282 if(mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3283 && 256U * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3284 && 256U * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3285 else *a = 255;
3286 }
3287 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3288 unsigned index;
3289 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) index = in[i];
3290 else {
3291 size_t j = i * mode->bitdepth;
3292 index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3293 }
3294 /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3295 *r = mode->palette[index * 4 + 0];
3296 *g = mode->palette[index * 4 + 1];
3297 *b = mode->palette[index * 4 + 2];
3298 *a = mode->palette[index * 4 + 3];
3299 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3300 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3301 *r = *g = *b = in[i * 2 + 0];
3302 *a = in[i * 2 + 1];
3303 } else {
3304 *r = *g = *b = in[i * 4 + 0];
3305 *a = in[i * 4 + 2];
3306 }
3307 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3308 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3309 *r = in[i * 4 + 0];
3310 *g = in[i * 4 + 1];
3311 *b = in[i * 4 + 2];
3312 *a = in[i * 4 + 3];
3313 } else {
3314 *r = in[i * 8 + 0];
3315 *g = in[i * 8 + 2];
3316 *b = in[i * 8 + 4];
3317 *a = in[i * 8 + 6];
3318 }
3319 }
3320}
3321
3322/*Similar to getPixelColorRGBA8, but with all the for loops inside of the color
3323mode test cases, optimized to convert the colors much faster, when converting
3324to the common case of RGBA with 8 bit per channel. buffer must be RGBA with
3325enough memory.*/
3326static void getPixelColorsRGBA8(unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT buffer, size_t numpixels,
3327 const unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT in,
3328 const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3329 unsigned num_channels = 4;
3330 size_t i;
3331 if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3332 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3333 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3334 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i];
3335 buffer[3] = 255;
3336 }
3337 if(mode->key_defined) {
3338 buffer -= numpixels * num_channels;
3339 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3340 if(buffer[0] == mode->key_r) buffer[3] = 0;
3341 }
3342 }
3343 } else if(mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3344 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3345 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2];
3346 buffer[3] = mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r ? 0 : 255;
3347 }
3348 } else {
3349 unsigned highest = ((1U << mode->bitdepth) - 1U); /*highest possible value for this bit depth*/
3350 size_t j = 0;
3351 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3352 unsigned value = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3353 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = (value * 255) / highest;
3354 buffer[3] = mode->key_defined && value == mode->key_r ? 0 : 255;
3355 }
3356 }
3357 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3358 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3359 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3360 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &in[i * 3], 3);
3361 buffer[3] = 255;
3362 }
3363 if(mode->key_defined) {
3364 buffer -= numpixels * num_channels;
3365 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3366 if(buffer[0] == mode->key_r && buffer[1]== mode->key_g && buffer[2] == mode->key_b) buffer[3] = 0;
3367 }
3368 }
3369 } else {
3370 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3371 buffer[0] = in[i * 6 + 0];
3372 buffer[1] = in[i * 6 + 2];
3373 buffer[2] = in[i * 6 + 4];
3374 buffer[3] = mode->key_defined
3375 && 256U * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3376 && 256U * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3377 && 256U * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b ? 0 : 255;
3378 }
3379 }
3380 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3381 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3382 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3383 unsigned index = in[i];
3384 /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3385 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 4);
3386 }
3387 } else {
3388 size_t j = 0;
3389 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3390 unsigned index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3391 /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3392 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 4);
3393 }
3394 }
3395 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3396 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3397 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3398 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2 + 0];
3399 buffer[3] = in[i * 2 + 1];
3400 }
3401 } else {
3402 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3403 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 4 + 0];
3404 buffer[3] = in[i * 4 + 2];
3405 }
3406 }
3407 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3408 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3409 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, in, numpixels * 4);
3410 } else {
3411 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3412 buffer[0] = in[i * 8 + 0];
3413 buffer[1] = in[i * 8 + 2];
3414 buffer[2] = in[i * 8 + 4];
3415 buffer[3] = in[i * 8 + 6];
3416 }
3417 }
3418 }
3419}
3420
3421/*Similar to getPixelColorsRGBA8, but with 3-channel RGB output.*/
3422static void getPixelColorsRGB8(unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT buffer, size_t numpixels,
3423 const unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT in,
3424 const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3425 const unsigned num_channels = 3;
3426 size_t i;
3427 if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3428 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3429 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3430 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i];
3431 }
3432 } else if(mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3433 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3434 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2];
3435 }
3436 } else {
3437 unsigned highest = ((1U << mode->bitdepth) - 1U); /*highest possible value for this bit depth*/
3438 size_t j = 0;
3439 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3440 unsigned value = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3441 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = (value * 255) / highest;
3442 }
3443 }
3444 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3445 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3446 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, in, numpixels * 3);
3447 } else {
3448 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3449 buffer[0] = in[i * 6 + 0];
3450 buffer[1] = in[i * 6 + 2];
3451 buffer[2] = in[i * 6 + 4];
3452 }
3453 }
3454 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3455 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3456 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3457 unsigned index = in[i];
3458 /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3459 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 3);
3460 }
3461 } else {
3462 size_t j = 0;
3463 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3464 unsigned index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3465 /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3466 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 3);
3467 }
3468 }
3469 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3470 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3471 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3472 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2 + 0];
3473 }
3474 } else {
3475 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3476 buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 4 + 0];
3477 }
3478 }
3479 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3480 if(mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3481 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3482 lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &in[i * 4], 3);
3483 }
3484 } else {
3485 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3486 buffer[0] = in[i * 8 + 0];
3487 buffer[1] = in[i * 8 + 2];
3488 buffer[2] = in[i * 8 + 4];
3489 }
3490 }
3491 }
3492}
3493
3494/*Get RGBA16 color of pixel with index i (y * width + x) from the raw image with
3495given color type, but the given color type must be 16-bit itself.*/
3496static void getPixelColorRGBA16(unsigned short* r, unsigned short* g, unsigned short* b, unsigned short* a,
3497 const unsigned char* in, size_t i, const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3498 if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3499 *r = *g = *b = 256 * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1];
3500 if(mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3501 else *a = 65535;
3502 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3503 *r = 256u * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1];
3504 *g = 256u * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3];
3505 *b = 256u * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5];
3506 if(mode->key_defined
3507 && 256u * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3508 && 256u * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3509 && 256u * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3510 else *a = 65535;
3511 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3512 *r = *g = *b = 256u * in[i * 4 + 0] + in[i * 4 + 1];
3513 *a = 256u * in[i * 4 + 2] + in[i * 4 + 3];
3514 } else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3515 *r = 256u * in[i * 8 + 0] + in[i * 8 + 1];
3516 *g = 256u * in[i * 8 + 2] + in[i * 8 + 3];
3517 *b = 256u * in[i * 8 + 4] + in[i * 8 + 5];
3518 *a = 256u * in[i * 8 + 6] + in[i * 8 + 7];
3519 }
3520}
3521
3522unsigned lodepng_convert(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
3523 const LodePNGColorMode* mode_out, const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in,
3524 unsigned w, unsigned h) {
3525 size_t i;
3526 ColorTree tree;
3527 size_t numpixels = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
3528 unsigned error = 0;
3529
3530 if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && !mode_in->palette) {
3531 return 107; /* error: must provide palette if input mode is palette */
3532 }
3533
3534 if(lodepng_color_mode_equal(mode_out, mode_in)) {
3535 size_t numbytes = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, mode_in);
3536 lodepng_memcpy(out, in, numbytes);
3537 return 0;
3538 }
3539
3540 if(mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3541 size_t palettesize = mode_out->palettesize;
3542 const unsigned char* palette = mode_out->palette;
3543 size_t palsize = (size_t)1u << mode_out->bitdepth;
3544 /*if the user specified output palette but did not give the values, assume
3545 they want the values of the input color type (assuming that one is palette).
3546 Note that we never create a new palette ourselves.*/
3547 if(palettesize == 0) {
3548 palettesize = mode_in->palettesize;
3549 palette = mode_in->palette;
3550 /*if the input was also palette with same bitdepth, then the color types are also
3551 equal, so copy literally. This to preserve the exact indices that were in the PNG
3552 even in case there are duplicate colors in the palette.*/
3553 if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && mode_in->bitdepth == mode_out->bitdepth) {
3554 size_t numbytes = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, mode_in);
3555 lodepng_memcpy(out, in, numbytes);
3556 return 0;
3557 }
3558 }
3559 if(palettesize < palsize) palsize = palettesize;
3560 color_tree_init(&tree);
3561 for(i = 0; i != palsize; ++i) {
3562 const unsigned char* p = &palette[i * 4];
3563 error = color_tree_add(&tree, p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], (unsigned)i);
3564 if(error) break;
3565 }
3566 }
3567
3568 if(!error) {
3569 if(mode_in->bitdepth == 16 && mode_out->bitdepth == 16) {
3570 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3571 unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3572 getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3573 rgba16ToPixel(out, i, mode_out, r, g, b, a);
3574 }
3575 } else if(mode_out->bitdepth == 8 && mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3576 getPixelColorsRGBA8(out, numpixels, in, mode_in);
3577 } else if(mode_out->bitdepth == 8 && mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3578 getPixelColorsRGB8(out, numpixels, in, mode_in);
3579 } else {
3580 unsigned char r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3581 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3582 getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3583 error = rgba8ToPixel(out, i, mode_out, &tree, r, g, b, a);
3584 if(error) break;
3585 }
3586 }
3587 }
3588
3589 if(mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3590 color_tree_cleanup(&tree);
3591 }
3592
3593 return error;
3594}
3595
3596
3597/* Converts a single rgb color without alpha from one type to another, color bits truncated to
3598their bitdepth. In case of single channel (gray or palette), only the r channel is used. Slow
3599function, do not use to process all pixels of an image. Alpha channel not supported on purpose:
3600this is for bKGD, supporting alpha may prevent it from finding a color in the palette, from the
3601specification it looks like bKGD should ignore the alpha values of the palette since it can use
3602any palette index but doesn't have an alpha channel. Idem with ignoring color key. */
3603unsigned lodepng_convert_rgb(
3604 unsigned* r_out, unsigned* g_out, unsigned* b_out,
3605 unsigned r_in, unsigned g_in, unsigned b_in,
3606 const LodePNGColorMode* mode_out, const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in) {
3607 unsigned r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
3608 unsigned mul = 65535 / ((1u << mode_in->bitdepth) - 1u); /*65535, 21845, 4369, 257, 1*/
3609 unsigned shift = 16 - mode_out->bitdepth;
3610
3611 if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_GREY || mode_in->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3612 r = g = b = r_in * mul;
3613 } else if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_RGB || mode_in->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3614 r = r_in * mul;
3615 g = g_in * mul;
3616 b = b_in * mul;
3617 } else if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3618 if(r_in >= mode_in->palettesize) return 82;
3619 r = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 0] * 257u;
3620 g = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 1] * 257u;
3621 b = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 2] * 257u;
3622 } else {
3623 return 31;
3624 }
3625
3626 /* now convert to output format */
3627 if(mode_out->colortype == LCT_GREY || mode_out->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3628 *r_out = r >> shift ;
3629 } else if(mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGB || mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3630 *r_out = r >> shift ;
3631 *g_out = g >> shift ;
3632 *b_out = b >> shift ;
3633 } else if(mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3634 unsigned i;
3635 /* a 16-bit color cannot be in the palette */
3636 if((r >> 8) != (r & 255) || (g >> 8) != (g & 255) || (b >> 8) != (b & 255)) return 82;
3637 for(i = 0; i < mode_out->palettesize; i++) {
3638 unsigned j = i * 4;
3639 if((r >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 0] && (g >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 1] &&
3640 (b >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 2]) {
3641 *r_out = i;
3642 return 0;
3643 }
3644 }
3645 return 82;
3646 } else {
3647 return 31;
3648 }
3649
3650 return 0;
3651}
3652
3653#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
3654
3655void lodepng_color_stats_init(LodePNGColorStats* stats) {
3656 /*stats*/
3657 stats->colored = 0;
3658 stats->key = 0;
3659 stats->key_r = stats->key_g = stats->key_b = 0;
3660 stats->alpha = 0;
3661 stats->numcolors = 0;
3662 stats->bits = 1;
3663 stats->numpixels = 0;
3664 /*settings*/
3665 stats->allow_palette = 1;
3666 stats->allow_greyscale = 1;
3667}
3668
3669/*function used for debug purposes with C++*/
3670/*void printColorStats(LodePNGColorStats* p) {
3671 std::cout << "colored: " << (int)p->colored << ", ";
3672 std::cout << "key: " << (int)p->key << ", ";
3673 std::cout << "key_r: " << (int)p->key_r << ", ";
3674 std::cout << "key_g: " << (int)p->key_g << ", ";
3675 std::cout << "key_b: " << (int)p->key_b << ", ";
3676 std::cout << "alpha: " << (int)p->alpha << ", ";
3677 std::cout << "numcolors: " << (int)p->numcolors << ", ";
3678 std::cout << "bits: " << (int)p->bits << std::endl;
3679}*/
3680
3681/*Returns how many bits needed to represent given value (max 8 bit)*/
3682static unsigned getValueRequiredBits(unsigned char value) {
3683 if(value == 0 || value == 255) return 1;
3684 /*The scaling of 2-bit and 4-bit values uses multiples of 85 and 17*/
3685 if(value % 17 == 0) return value % 85 == 0 ? 2 : 4;
3686 return 8;
3687}
3688
3689/*stats must already have been inited. */
3690unsigned lodepng_compute_color_stats(LodePNGColorStats* stats,
3691 const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
3692 const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in) {
3693 size_t i;
3694 ColorTree tree;
3695 size_t numpixels = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
3696 unsigned error = 0;
3697
3698 /* mark things as done already if it would be impossible to have a more expensive case */
3699 unsigned colored_done = lodepng_is_greyscale_type(mode_in) ? 1 : 0;
3700 unsigned alpha_done = lodepng_can_have_alpha(mode_in) ? 0 : 1;
3701 unsigned numcolors_done = 0;
3702 unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(mode_in);
3703 unsigned bits_done = (stats->bits == 1 && bpp == 1) ? 1 : 0;
3704 unsigned sixteen = 0; /* whether the input image is 16 bit */
3705 unsigned maxnumcolors = 257;
3706 if(bpp <= 8) maxnumcolors = LODEPNG_MIN(257, stats->numcolors + (1u << bpp));
3707
3708 stats->numpixels += numpixels;
3709
3710 /*if palette not allowed, no need to compute numcolors*/
3711 if(!stats->allow_palette) numcolors_done = 1;
3712
3713 color_tree_init(&tree);
3714
3715 /*If the stats was already filled in from previous data, fill its palette in tree
3716 and mark things as done already if we know they are the most expensive case already*/
3717 if(stats->alpha) alpha_done = 1;
3718 if(stats->colored) colored_done = 1;
3719 if(stats->bits == 16) numcolors_done = 1;
3720 if(stats->bits >= bpp) bits_done = 1;
3721 if(stats->numcolors >= maxnumcolors) numcolors_done = 1;
3722
3723 if(!numcolors_done) {
3724 for(i = 0; i < stats->numcolors; i++) {
3725 const unsigned char* color = &stats->palette[i * 4];
3726 error = color_tree_add(&tree, color[0], color[1], color[2], color[3], i);
3727 if(error) goto cleanup;
3728 }
3729 }
3730
3731 /*Check if the 16-bit input is truly 16-bit*/
3732 if(mode_in->bitdepth == 16 && !sixteen) {
3733 unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3734 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3735 getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3736 if((r & 255) != ((r >> 8) & 255) || (g & 255) != ((g >> 8) & 255) ||
3737 (b & 255) != ((b >> 8) & 255) || (a & 255) != ((a >> 8) & 255)) /*first and second byte differ*/ {
3738 stats->bits = 16;
3739 sixteen = 1;
3740 bits_done = 1;
3741 numcolors_done = 1; /*counting colors no longer useful, palette doesn't support 16-bit*/
3742 break;
3743 }
3744 }
3745 }
3746
3747 if(sixteen) {
3748 unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3749
3750 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3751 getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3752
3753 if(!colored_done && (r != g || r != b)) {
3754 stats->colored = 1;
3755 colored_done = 1;
3756 }
3757
3758 if(!alpha_done) {
3759 unsigned matchkey = (r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b);
3760 if(a != 65535 && (a != 0 || (stats->key && !matchkey))) {
3761 stats->alpha = 1;
3762 stats->key = 0;
3763 alpha_done = 1;
3764 } else if(a == 0 && !stats->alpha && !stats->key) {
3765 stats->key = 1;
3766 stats->key_r = r;
3767 stats->key_g = g;
3768 stats->key_b = b;
3769 } else if(a == 65535 && stats->key && matchkey) {
3770 /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3771 stats->alpha = 1;
3772 stats->key = 0;
3773 alpha_done = 1;
3774 }
3775 }
3776 if(alpha_done && numcolors_done && colored_done && bits_done) break;
3777 }
3778
3779 if(stats->key && !stats->alpha) {
3780 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3781 getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3782 if(a != 0 && r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b) {
3783 /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3784 stats->alpha = 1;
3785 stats->key = 0;
3786 alpha_done = 1;
3787 }
3788 }
3789 }
3790 } else /* < 16-bit */ {
3791 unsigned char r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3792 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3793 getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3794
3795 if(!bits_done && stats->bits < 8) {
3796 /*only r is checked, < 8 bits is only relevant for grayscale*/
3797 unsigned bits = getValueRequiredBits(r);
3798 if(bits > stats->bits) stats->bits = bits;
3799 }
3800 bits_done = (stats->bits >= bpp);
3801
3802 if(!colored_done && (r != g || r != b)) {
3803 stats->colored = 1;
3804 colored_done = 1;
3805 if(stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no colored modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3806 }
3807
3808 if(!alpha_done) {
3809 unsigned matchkey = (r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b);
3810 if(a != 255 && (a != 0 || (stats->key && !matchkey))) {
3811 stats->alpha = 1;
3812 stats->key = 0;
3813 alpha_done = 1;
3814 if(stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3815 } else if(a == 0 && !stats->alpha && !stats->key) {
3816 stats->key = 1;
3817 stats->key_r = r;
3818 stats->key_g = g;
3819 stats->key_b = b;
3820 } else if(a == 255 && stats->key && matchkey) {
3821 /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3822 stats->alpha = 1;
3823 stats->key = 0;
3824 alpha_done = 1;
3825 if(stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3826 }
3827 }
3828
3829 if(!numcolors_done) {
3830 if(!color_tree_has(&tree, r, g, b, a)) {
3831 error = color_tree_add(&tree, r, g, b, a, stats->numcolors);
3832 if(error) goto cleanup;
3833 if(stats->numcolors < 256) {
3834 unsigned char* p = stats->palette;
3835 unsigned n = stats->numcolors;
3836 p[n * 4 + 0] = r;
3837 p[n * 4 + 1] = g;
3838 p[n * 4 + 2] = b;
3839 p[n * 4 + 3] = a;
3840 }
3841 ++stats->numcolors;
3842 numcolors_done = stats->numcolors >= maxnumcolors;
3843 }
3844 }
3845
3846 if(alpha_done && numcolors_done && colored_done && bits_done) break;
3847 }
3848
3849 if(stats->key && !stats->alpha) {
3850 for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3851 getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3852 if(a != 0 && r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b) {
3853 /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3854 stats->alpha = 1;
3855 stats->key = 0;
3856 alpha_done = 1;
3857 if(stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3858 }
3859 }
3860 }
3861
3862 /*make the stats's key always 16-bit for consistency - repeat each byte twice*/
3863 stats->key_r += (stats->key_r << 8);
3864 stats->key_g += (stats->key_g << 8);
3865 stats->key_b += (stats->key_b << 8);
3866 }
3867
3868cleanup:
3869 color_tree_cleanup(&tree);
3870 return error;
3871}
3872
3873#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3874/*Adds a single color to the color stats. The stats must already have been inited. The color must be given as 16-bit
3875(with 2 bytes repeating for 8-bit and 65535 for opaque alpha channel). This function is expensive, do not call it for
3876all pixels of an image but only for a few additional values. */
3877static unsigned lodepng_color_stats_add(LodePNGColorStats* stats,
3878 unsigned r, unsigned g, unsigned b, unsigned a) {
3879 unsigned error = 0;
3880 unsigned char image[8];
3881 LodePNGColorMode mode;
3882 lodepng_color_mode_init(&mode);
3883 image[0] = r >> 8; image[1] = r; image[2] = g >> 8; image[3] = g;
3884 image[4] = b >> 8; image[5] = b; image[6] = a >> 8; image[7] = a;
3885 mode.bitdepth = 16;
3886 mode.colortype = LCT_RGBA;
3887 error = lodepng_compute_color_stats(stats, image, 1, 1, &mode);
3888 lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&mode);
3889 return error;
3890}
3891#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3892
3893/*Computes a minimal PNG color model that can contain all colors as indicated by the stats.
3894The stats should be computed with lodepng_compute_color_stats.
3895mode_in is raw color profile of the image the stats were computed on, to copy palette order from when relevant.
3896Minimal PNG color model means the color type and bit depth that gives smallest amount of bits in the output image,
3897e.g. gray if only grayscale pixels, palette if less than 256 colors, color key if only single transparent color, ...
3898This is used if auto_convert is enabled (it is by default).
3899*/
3900static unsigned auto_choose_color(LodePNGColorMode* mode_out,
3901 const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in,
3902 const LodePNGColorStats* stats) {
3903 unsigned error = 0;
3904 unsigned palettebits;
3905 size_t i, n;
3906 size_t numpixels = stats->numpixels;
3907 unsigned palette_ok, gray_ok;
3908
3909 unsigned alpha = stats->alpha;
3910 unsigned key = stats->key;
3911 unsigned bits = stats->bits;
3912
3913 mode_out->key_defined = 0;
3914
3915 if(key && numpixels <= 16) {
3916 alpha = 1; /*too few pixels to justify tRNS chunk overhead*/
3917 key = 0;
3918 if(bits < 8) bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3919 }
3920
3921 gray_ok = !stats->colored;
3922 if(!stats->allow_greyscale) gray_ok = 0;
3923 if(!gray_ok && bits < 8) bits = 8;
3924
3925 n = stats->numcolors;
3926 palettebits = n <= 2 ? 1 : (n <= 4 ? 2 : (n <= 16 ? 4 : 8));
3927 palette_ok = n <= 256 && bits <= 8 && n != 0; /*n==0 means likely numcolors wasn't computed*/
3928 if(numpixels < n * 2) palette_ok = 0; /*don't add palette overhead if image has only a few pixels*/
3929 if(gray_ok && !alpha && bits <= palettebits) palette_ok = 0; /*gray is less overhead*/
3930 if(!stats->allow_palette) palette_ok = 0;
3931
3932 if(palette_ok) {
3933 const unsigned char* p = stats->palette;
3934 lodepng_palette_clear(mode_out); /*remove potential earlier palette*/
3935 for(i = 0; i != stats->numcolors; ++i) {
3936 error = lodepng_palette_add(mode_out, p[i * 4 + 0], p[i * 4 + 1], p[i * 4 + 2], p[i * 4 + 3]);
3937 if(error) break;
3938 }
3939
3940 mode_out->colortype = LCT_PALETTE;
3941 mode_out->bitdepth = palettebits;
3942
3943 if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && mode_in->palettesize >= mode_out->palettesize
3944 && mode_in->bitdepth == mode_out->bitdepth) {
3945 /*If input should have same palette colors, keep original to preserve its order and prevent conversion*/
3946 lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(mode_out); /*clears palette, keeps the above set colortype and bitdepth fields as-is*/
3947 lodepng_color_mode_copy(mode_out, mode_in);
3948 }
3949 } else /*8-bit or 16-bit per channel*/ {
3950 mode_out->bitdepth = bits;
