3951 mode_out->colortype = alpha ? (gray_ok ? LCT_GREY_ALPHA : LCT_RGBA)
3952 : (gray_ok ? LCT_GREY : LCT_RGB);
3953 if(key) {
3954 unsigned mask = (1u << mode_out->bitdepth) - 1u; /*stats always uses 16-bit, mask converts it*/
3955 mode_out->key_r = stats->key_r & mask;
3956 mode_out->key_g = stats->key_g & mask;
3957 mode_out->key_b = stats->key_b & mask;
3958 mode_out->key_defined = 1;
3959 }
3960 }
3961
3962 return error;
3963}
3964
3965#endif /* #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER */
3966
3967/*
3968Paeth predictor, used by PNG filter type 4
3969The parameters are of type short, but should come from unsigned chars, the shorts
3970are only needed to make the paeth calculation correct.
3971*/
3972static unsigned char paethPredictor(short a, short b, short c) {
3973 short pa = LODEPNG_ABS(b - c);
3974 short pb = LODEPNG_ABS(a - c);
3975 short pc = LODEPNG_ABS(a + b - c - c);
3976 /* return input value associated with smallest of pa, pb, pc (with certain priority if equal) */
3977 if(pb < pa) { a = b; pa = pb; }
3978 return (pc < pa) ? c : a;
3979}
3980
3981/*shared values used by multiple Adam7 related functions*/
3982
3983static const unsigned ADAM7_IX[7] = { 0, 4, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0 }; /*x start values*/
3984static const unsigned ADAM7_IY[7] = { 0, 0, 4, 0, 2, 0, 1 }; /*y start values*/
3985static const unsigned ADAM7_DX[7] = { 8, 8, 4, 4, 2, 2, 1 }; /*x delta values*/
3986static const unsigned ADAM7_DY[7] = { 8, 8, 8, 4, 4, 2, 2 }; /*y delta values*/
3987
3988/*
3989Outputs various dimensions and positions in the image related to the Adam7 reduced images.
3990passw: output containing the width of the 7 passes
3991passh: output containing the height of the 7 passes
3992filter_passstart: output containing the index of the start and end of each
3993 reduced image with filter bytes
3994padded_passstart output containing the index of the start and end of each
3995 reduced image when without filter bytes but with padded scanlines
3996passstart: output containing the index of the start and end of each reduced
3997 image without padding between scanlines, but still padding between the images
3998w, h: width and height of non-interlaced image
3999bpp: bits per pixel
4000"padded" is only relevant if bpp is less than 8 and a scanline or image does not
4001 end at a full byte
4002*/
4003static void Adam7_getpassvalues(unsigned passw[7], unsigned passh[7], size_t filter_passstart[8],
4004 size_t padded_passstart[8], size_t passstart[8], unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
4005 /*the passstart values have 8 values: the 8th one indicates the byte after the end of the 7th (= last) pass*/
4006 unsigned i;
4007
4008 /*calculate width and height in pixels of each pass*/
4009 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4010 passw[i] = (w + ADAM7_DX[i] - ADAM7_IX[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DX[i];
4011 passh[i] = (h + ADAM7_DY[i] - ADAM7_IY[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DY[i];
4012 if(passw[i] == 0) passh[i] = 0;
4013 if(passh[i] == 0) passw[i] = 0;
4014 }
4015
4016 filter_passstart[0] = padded_passstart[0] = passstart[0] = 0;
4017 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4018 /*if passw[i] is 0, it's 0 bytes, not 1 (no filtertype-byte)*/
4019 filter_passstart[i + 1] = filter_passstart[i]
4020 + ((passw[i] && passh[i]) ? passh[i] * (1u + (passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) : 0);
4021 /*bits padded if needed to fill full byte at end of each scanline*/
4022 padded_passstart[i + 1] = padded_passstart[i] + passh[i] * ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u);
4023 /*only padded at end of reduced image*/
4024 passstart[i + 1] = passstart[i] + (passh[i] * passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
4025 }
4026}
4027
4028#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
4029
4030/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
4031/* / PNG Decoder / */
4032/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
4033
4034/*read the information from the header and store it in the LodePNGInfo. return value is error*/
4035unsigned lodepng_inspect(unsigned* w, unsigned* h, LodePNGState* state,
4036 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
4037 unsigned width, height;
4038 LodePNGInfo* info = &state->info_png;
4039 if(insize == 0 || in == 0) {
4040 CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 48); /*error: the given data is empty*/
4041 }
4042 if(insize < 33) {
4043 CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 27); /*error: the data length is smaller than the length of a PNG header*/
4044 }
4045
4046 /*when decoding a new PNG image, make sure all parameters created after previous decoding are reset*/
4047 /* TODO: remove this. One should use a new LodePNGState for new sessions */
4048 lodepng_info_cleanup(info);
4049 lodepng_info_init(info);
4050
4051 if(in[0] != 137 || in[1] != 80 || in[2] != 78 || in[3] != 71
4052 || in[4] != 13 || in[5] != 10 || in[6] != 26 || in[7] != 10) {
4053 CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 28); /*error: the first 8 bytes are not the correct PNG signature*/
4054 }
4055 if(lodepng_chunk_length(in + 8) != 13) {
4056 CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 94); /*error: header size must be 13 bytes*/
4057 }
4058 if(!lodepng_chunk_type_equals(in + 8, "IHDR")) {
4059 CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 29); /*error: it doesn't start with a IHDR chunk!*/
4060 }
4061
4062 /*read the values given in the header*/
4063 width = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[16]);
4064 height = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[20]);
4065 /*TODO: remove the undocumented feature that allows to give null pointers to width or height*/
4066 if(w) *w = width;
4067 if(h) *h = height;
4068 info->color.bitdepth = in[24];
4069 info->color.colortype = (LodePNGColorType)in[25];
4070 info->compression_method = in[26];
4071 info->filter_method = in[27];
4072 info->interlace_method = in[28];
4073
4074 /*errors returned only after the parsing so other values are still output*/
4075
4076 /*error: invalid image size*/
4077 if(width == 0 || height == 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 93);
4078 /*error: invalid colortype or bitdepth combination*/
4079 state->error = checkColorValidity(info->color.colortype, info->color.bitdepth);
4080 if(state->error) return state->error;
4081 /*error: only compression method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
4082 if(info->compression_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 32);
4083 /*error: only filter method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
4084 if(info->filter_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 33);
4085 /*error: only interlace methods 0 and 1 exist in the specification*/
4086 if(info->interlace_method > 1) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 34);
4087
4088 if(!state->decoder.ignore_crc) {
4089 unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[29]);
4090 unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&in[12], 17);
4091 if(CRC != checksum) {
4092 CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
4093 }
4094 }
4095
4096 return state->error;
4097}
4098
4099static unsigned unfilterScanline(unsigned char* recon, const unsigned char* scanline, const unsigned char* precon,
4100 size_t bytewidth, unsigned char filterType, size_t length) {
4101 /*
4102 For PNG filter method 0
4103 unfilter a PNG image scanline by scanline. when the pixels are smaller than 1 byte,
4104 the filter works byte per byte (bytewidth = 1)
4105 precon is the previous unfiltered scanline, recon the result, scanline the current one
4106 the incoming scanlines do NOT include the filtertype byte, that one is given in the parameter filterType instead
4107 recon and scanline MAY be the same memory address! precon must be disjoint.
4108 */
4109
4110 size_t i;
4111 switch(filterType) {
4112 case 0:
4113 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4114 break;
4115 case 1: {
4116 size_t j = 0;
4117 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4118 for(i = bytewidth; i != length; ++i, ++j) recon[i] = scanline[i] + recon[j];
4119 break;
4120 }
4121 case 2:
4122 if(precon) {
4123 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + precon[i];
4124 } else {
4125 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4126 }
4127 break;
4128 case 3:
4129 if(precon) {
4130 size_t j = 0;
4131 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (precon[i] >> 1u);
4132 /* Unroll independent paths of this predictor. A 6x and 8x version is also possible but that adds
4133 too much code. Whether this speeds up anything depends on compiler and settings. */
4134 if(bytewidth >= 4) {
4135 for(; i + 3 < length; i += 4, j += 4) {
4136 unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2], s3 = scanline[i + 3];
4137 unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2], r3 = recon[j + 3];
4138 unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2], p3 = precon[i + 3];
4139 recon[i + 0] = s0 + ((r0 + p0) >> 1u);
4140 recon[i + 1] = s1 + ((r1 + p1) >> 1u);
4141 recon[i + 2] = s2 + ((r2 + p2) >> 1u);
4142 recon[i + 3] = s3 + ((r3 + p3) >> 1u);
4143 }
4144 } else if(bytewidth >= 3) {
4145 for(; i + 2 < length; i += 3, j += 3) {
4146 unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2];
4147 unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2];
4148 unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2];
4149 recon[i + 0] = s0 + ((r0 + p0) >> 1u);
4150 recon[i + 1] = s1 + ((r1 + p1) >> 1u);
4151 recon[i + 2] = s2 + ((r2 + p2) >> 1u);
4152 }
4153 } else if(bytewidth >= 2) {
4154 for(; i + 1 < length; i += 2, j += 2) {
4155 unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1];
4156 unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1];
4157 unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1];
4158 recon[i + 0] = s0 + ((r0 + p0) >> 1u);
4159 recon[i + 1] = s1 + ((r1 + p1) >> 1u);
4160 }
4161 }
4162 for(; i != length; ++i, ++j) recon[i] = scanline[i] + ((recon[j] + precon[i]) >> 1u);
4163 } else {
4164 size_t j = 0;
4165 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4166 for(i = bytewidth; i != length; ++i, ++j) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (recon[j] >> 1u);
4167 }
4168 break;
4169 case 4:
4170 if(precon) {
4171 size_t j = 0;
4172 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) {
4173 recon[i] = (scanline[i] + precon[i]); /*paethPredictor(0, precon[i], 0) is always precon[i]*/
4174 }
4175
4176 /* Unroll independent paths of the paeth predictor. A 6x and 8x version is also possible but that
4177 adds too much code. Whether this speeds up anything depends on compiler and settings. */
4178 if(bytewidth >= 4) {
4179 for(; i + 3 < length; i += 4, j += 4) {
4180 unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2], s3 = scanline[i + 3];
4181 unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2], r3 = recon[j + 3];
4182 unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2], p3 = precon[i + 3];
4183 unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1], q2 = precon[j + 2], q3 = precon[j + 3];
4184 recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4185 recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4186 recon[i + 2] = s2 + paethPredictor(r2, p2, q2);
4187 recon[i + 3] = s3 + paethPredictor(r3, p3, q3);
4188 }
4189 } else if(bytewidth >= 3) {
4190 for(; i + 2 < length; i += 3, j += 3) {
4191 unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2];
4192 unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2];
4193 unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2];
4194 unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1], q2 = precon[j + 2];
4195 recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4196 recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4197 recon[i + 2] = s2 + paethPredictor(r2, p2, q2);
4198 }
4199 } else if(bytewidth >= 2) {
4200 for(; i + 1 < length; i += 2, j += 2) {
4201 unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1];
4202 unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1];
4203 unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1];
4204 unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1];
4205 recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4206 recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4207 }
4208 }
4209
4210 for(; i != length; ++i, ++j) {
4211 recon[i] = (scanline[i] + paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], precon[i], precon[j]));
4212 }
4213 } else {
4214 size_t j = 0;
4215 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) {
4216 recon[i] = scanline[i];
4217 }
4218 for(i = bytewidth; i != length; ++i, ++j) {
4219 /*paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always recon[i - bytewidth]*/
4220 recon[i] = (scanline[i] + recon[j]);
4221 }
4222 }
4223 break;
4224 default: return 36; /*error: invalid filter type given*/
4225 }
4226 return 0;
4227}
4228
4229static unsigned unfilter(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
4230 /*
4231 For PNG filter method 0
4232 this function unfilters a single image (e.g. without interlacing this is called once, with Adam7 seven times)
4233 out must have enough bytes allocated already, in must have the scanlines + 1 filtertype byte per scanline
4234 w and h are image dimensions or dimensions of reduced image, bpp is bits per pixel
4235 in and out are allowed to be the same memory address (but aren't the same size since in has the extra filter bytes)
4236 */
4237
4238 unsigned y;
4239 unsigned char* prevline = 0;
4240
4241 /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
4242 size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7u) / 8u;
4243 /*the width of a scanline in bytes, not including the filter type*/
4244 size_t linebytes = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(w, 1, bpp) - 1u;
4245
4246 for(y = 0; y < h; ++y) {
4247 size_t outindex = linebytes * y;
4248 size_t inindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
4249 unsigned char filterType = in[inindex];
4250
4251 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilterScanline(&out[outindex], &in[inindex + 1], prevline, bytewidth, filterType, linebytes));
4252
4253 prevline = &out[outindex];
4254 }
4255
4256 return 0;
4257}
4258
4259/*
4260in: Adam7 interlaced image, with no padding bits between scanlines, but between
4261 reduced images so that each reduced image starts at a byte.
4262out: the same pixels, but re-ordered so that they're now a non-interlaced image with size w*h
4263bpp: bits per pixel
4264out has the following size in bits: w * h * bpp.
4265in is possibly bigger due to padding bits between reduced images.
4266out must be big enough AND must be 0 everywhere if bpp < 8 in the current implementation
4267(because that's likely a little bit faster)
4268NOTE: comments about padding bits are only relevant if bpp < 8
4269*/
4270static void Adam7_deinterlace(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
4271 unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
4272 size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4273 unsigned i;
4274
4275 Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4276
4277 if(bpp >= 8) {
4278 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4279 unsigned x, y, b;
4280 size_t bytewidth = bpp / 8u;
4281 for(y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4282 for(x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
4283 size_t pixelinstart = passstart[i] + (y * passw[i] + x) * bytewidth;
4284 size_t pixeloutstart = ((ADAM7_IY[i] + (size_t)y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * (size_t)w
4285 + ADAM7_IX[i] + (size_t)x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bytewidth;
4286 for(b = 0; b < bytewidth; ++b) {
4287 out[pixeloutstart + b] = in[pixelinstart + b];
4288 }
4289 }
4290 }
4291 } else /*bpp < 8: Adam7 with pixels < 8 bit is a bit trickier: with bit pointers*/ {
4292 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4293 unsigned x, y, b;
4294 unsigned ilinebits = bpp * passw[i];
4295 unsigned olinebits = bpp * w;
4296 size_t obp, ibp; /*bit pointers (for out and in buffer)*/
4297 for(y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4298 for(x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
4299 ibp = (8 * passstart[i]) + (y * ilinebits + x * bpp);
4300 obp = (ADAM7_IY[i] + (size_t)y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * olinebits + (ADAM7_IX[i] + (size_t)x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bpp;
4301 for(b = 0; b < bpp; ++b) {
4302 unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4303 setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4304 }
4305 }
4306 }
4307 }
4308}
4309
4310static void removePaddingBits(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
4311 size_t olinebits, size_t ilinebits, unsigned h) {
4312 /*
4313 After filtering there are still padding bits if scanlines have non multiple of 8 bit amounts. They need
4314 to be removed (except at last scanline of (Adam7-reduced) image) before working with pure image buffers
4315 for the Adam7 code, the color convert code and the output to the user.
4316 in and out are allowed to be the same buffer, in may also be higher but still overlapping; in must
4317 have >= ilinebits*h bits, out must have >= olinebits*h bits, olinebits must be <= ilinebits
4318 also used to move bits after earlier such operations happened, e.g. in a sequence of reduced images from Adam7
4319 only useful if (ilinebits - olinebits) is a value in the range 1..7
4320 */
4321 unsigned y;
4322 size_t diff = ilinebits - olinebits;
4323 size_t ibp = 0, obp = 0; /*input and output bit pointers*/
4324 for(y = 0; y < h; ++y) {
4325 size_t x;
4326 for(x = 0; x < olinebits; ++x) {
4327 unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4328 setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4329 }
4330 ibp += diff;
4331 }
4332}
4333
4334/*out must be buffer big enough to contain full image, and in must contain the full decompressed data from
4335the IDAT chunks (with filter index bytes and possible padding bits)
4336return value is error*/
4337static unsigned postProcessScanlines(unsigned char* out, unsigned char* in,
4338 unsigned w, unsigned h, const LodePNGInfo* info_png) {
4339 /*
4340 This function converts the filtered-padded-interlaced data into pure 2D image buffer with the PNG's colortype.
4341 Steps:
4342 *) if no Adam7: 1) unfilter 2) remove padding bits (= possible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8)
4343 *) if adam7: 1) 7x unfilter 2) 7x remove padding bits 3) Adam7_deinterlace
4344 NOTE: the in buffer will be overwritten with intermediate data!
4345 */
4346 unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
4347 if(bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid colortype*/
4348
4349 if(info_png->interlace_method == 0) {
4350 if(bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u) {
4351 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(in, in, w, h, bpp));
4352 removePaddingBits(out, in, w * bpp, ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, h);
4353 }
4354 /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
4355 else CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(out, in, w, h, bpp));
4356 } else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/ {
4357 unsigned passw[7], passh[7]; size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4358 unsigned i;
4359
4360 Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4361
4362 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4363 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(&in[padded_passstart[i]], &in[filter_passstart[i]], passw[i], passh[i], bpp));
4364 /*TODO: possible efficiency improvement: if in this reduced image the bits fit nicely in 1 scanline,
4365 move bytes instead of bits or move not at all*/
4366 if(bpp < 8) {
4367 /*remove padding bits in scanlines; after this there still may be padding
4368 bits between the different reduced images: each reduced image still starts nicely at a byte*/
4369 removePaddingBits(&in[passstart[i]], &in[padded_passstart[i]], passw[i] * bpp,
4370 ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, passh[i]);
4371 }
4372 }
4373
4374 Adam7_deinterlace(out, in, w, h, bpp);
4375 }
4376
4377 return 0;
4378}
4379
4380static unsigned readChunk_PLTE(LodePNGColorMode* color, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4381 unsigned pos = 0, i;
4382 color->palettesize = chunkLength / 3u;
4383 if(color->palettesize == 0 || color->palettesize > 256) return 38; /*error: palette too small or big*/
4384 lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette(color);
4385 if(!color->palette && color->palettesize) {
4386 color->palettesize = 0;
4387 return 83; /*alloc fail*/
4388 }
4389
4390 for(i = 0; i != color->palettesize; ++i) {
4391 color->palette[4 * i + 0] = data[pos++]; /*R*/
4392 color->palette[4 * i + 1] = data[pos++]; /*G*/
4393 color->palette[4 * i + 2] = data[pos++]; /*B*/
4394 color->palette[4 * i + 3] = 255; /*alpha*/
4395 }
4396
4397 return 0; /* OK */
4398}
4399
4400static unsigned readChunk_tRNS(LodePNGColorMode* color, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4401 unsigned i;
4402 if(color->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
4403 /*error: more alpha values given than there are palette entries*/
4404 if(chunkLength > color->palettesize) return 39;
4405
4406 for(i = 0; i != chunkLength; ++i) color->palette[4 * i + 3] = data[i];
4407 } else if(color->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
4408 /*error: this chunk must be 2 bytes for grayscale image*/
4409 if(chunkLength != 2) return 30;
4410
4411 color->key_defined = 1;
4412 color->key_r = color->key_g = color->key_b = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4413 } else if(color->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
4414 /*error: this chunk must be 6 bytes for RGB image*/
4415 if(chunkLength != 6) return 41;
4416
4417 color->key_defined = 1;
4418 color->key_r = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4419 color->key_g = 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4420 color->key_b = 256u * data[4] + data[5];
4421 }
4422 else return 42; /*error: tRNS chunk not allowed for other color models*/
4423
4424 return 0; /* OK */
4425}
4426
4427
4428#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4429/*background color chunk (bKGD)*/
4430static unsigned readChunk_bKGD(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4431 if(info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
4432 /*error: this chunk must be 1 byte for indexed color image*/
4433 if(chunkLength != 1) return 43;
4434
4435 /*error: invalid palette index, or maybe this chunk appeared before PLTE*/
4436 if(data[0] >= info->color.palettesize) return 103;
4437
4438 info->background_defined = 1;
4439 info->background_r = info->background_g = info->background_b = data[0];
4440 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
4441 /*error: this chunk must be 2 bytes for grayscale image*/
4442 if(chunkLength != 2) return 44;
4443
4444 /*the values are truncated to bitdepth in the PNG file*/
4445 info->background_defined = 1;
4446 info->background_r = info->background_g = info->background_b = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4447 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info->color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
4448 /*error: this chunk must be 6 bytes for grayscale image*/
4449 if(chunkLength != 6) return 45;
4450
4451 /*the values are truncated to bitdepth in the PNG file*/
4452 info->background_defined = 1;
4453 info->background_r = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4454 info->background_g = 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4455 info->background_b = 256u * data[4] + data[5];
4456 }
4457
4458 return 0; /* OK */
4459}
4460
4461/*text chunk (tEXt)*/
4462static unsigned readChunk_tEXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4463 unsigned error = 0;
4464 char *key = 0, *str = 0;
4465
4466 while(!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/ {
4467 unsigned length, string2_begin;
4468
4469 length = 0;
4470 while(length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0) ++length;
4471 /*even though it's not allowed by the standard, no error is thrown if
4472 there's no null termination char, if the text is empty*/
4473 if(length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4474
4475 key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4476 if(!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4477
4478 lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4479 key[length] = 0;
4480
4481 string2_begin = length + 1; /*skip keyword null terminator*/
4482
4483 length = (unsigned)(chunkLength < string2_begin ? 0 : chunkLength - string2_begin);
4484 str = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4485 if(!str) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4486
4487 lodepng_memcpy(str, data + string2_begin, length);
4488 str[length] = 0;
4489
4490 error = lodepng_add_text(info, key, str);
4491
4492 break;
4493 }
4494
4495 lodepng_free(key);
4496 lodepng_free(str);
4497
4498 return error;
4499}
4500
4501/*compressed text chunk (zTXt)*/
4502static unsigned readChunk_zTXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecoderSettings* decoder,
4503 const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4504 unsigned error = 0;
4505
4506 /*copy the object to change parameters in it*/
4507 LodePNGDecompressSettings zlibsettings = decoder->zlibsettings;
4508
4509 unsigned length, string2_begin;
4510 char *key = 0;
4511 unsigned char* str = 0;
4512 size_t size = 0;
4513
4514 while(!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/ {
4515 for(length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length) ;
4516 if(length + 2 >= chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4517 if(length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4518
4519 key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4520 if(!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4521
4522 lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4523 key[length] = 0;
4524
4525 if(data[length + 1] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4526
4527 string2_begin = length + 2;
4528 if(string2_begin > chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4529
4530 length = (unsigned)chunkLength - string2_begin;
4531 zlibsettings.max_output_size = decoder->max_text_size;
4532 /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/
4533 error = zlib_decompress(&str, &size, 0, &data[string2_begin],
4534 length, &zlibsettings);
4535 /*error: compressed text larger than decoder->max_text_size*/
4536 if(error && size > zlibsettings.max_output_size) error = 112;
4537 if(error) break;
4538 error = lodepng_add_text_sized(info, key, (char*)str, size);
4539 break;
4540 }
4541
4542 lodepng_free(key);
4543 lodepng_free(str);
4544
4545 return error;
4546}
4547
4548/*international text chunk (iTXt)*/
4549static unsigned readChunk_iTXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecoderSettings* decoder,
4550 const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4551 unsigned error = 0;
4552 unsigned i;
4553
4554 /*copy the object to change parameters in it*/
4555 LodePNGDecompressSettings zlibsettings = decoder->zlibsettings;
4556
4557 unsigned length, begin, compressed;
4558 char *key = 0, *langtag = 0, *transkey = 0;
4559
4560 while(!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/ {
4561 /*Quick check if the chunk length isn't too small. Even without check
4562 it'd still fail with other error checks below if it's too short. This just gives a different error code.*/
4563 if(chunkLength < 5) CERROR_BREAK(error, 30); /*iTXt chunk too short*/
4564
4565 /*read the key*/
4566 for(length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length) ;
4567 if(length + 3 >= chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination char, corrupt?*/
4568 if(length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4569
4570 key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4571 if(!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4572
4573 lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4574 key[length] = 0;
4575
4576 /*read the compression method*/
4577 compressed = data[length + 1];
4578 if(data[length + 2] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4579
4580 /*even though it's not allowed by the standard, no error is thrown if
4581 there's no null termination char, if the text is empty for the next 3 texts*/
4582
4583 /*read the langtag*/
4584 begin = length + 3;
4585 length = 0;
4586 for(i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;
4587
4588 langtag = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4589 if(!langtag) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4590
4591 lodepng_memcpy(langtag, data + begin, length);
4592 langtag[length] = 0;
4593
4594 /*read the transkey*/
4595 begin += length + 1;
4596 length = 0;
4597 for(i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;
4598
4599 transkey = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4600 if(!transkey) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4601
4602 lodepng_memcpy(transkey, data + begin, length);
4603 transkey[length] = 0;
4604
4605 /*read the actual text*/
4606 begin += length + 1;
4607
4608 length = (unsigned)chunkLength < begin ? 0 : (unsigned)chunkLength - begin;
4609
4610 if(compressed) {
4611 unsigned char* str = 0;
4612 size_t size = 0;
4613 zlibsettings.max_output_size = decoder->max_text_size;
4614 /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/
4615 error = zlib_decompress(&str, &size, 0, &data[begin],
4616 length, &zlibsettings);
4617 /*error: compressed text larger than decoder->max_text_size*/
4618 if(error && size > zlibsettings.max_output_size) error = 112;
4619 if(!error) error = lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, (char*)str, size);
4620 lodepng_free(str);
4621 } else {
4622 error = lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, (char*)(data + begin), length);
4623 }
4624
4625 break;
4626 }
4627
4628 lodepng_free(key);
4629 lodepng_free(langtag);
4630 lodepng_free(transkey);
4631
4632 return error;
4633}
4634
4635static unsigned readChunk_tIME(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4636 if(chunkLength != 7) return 73; /*invalid tIME chunk size*/
4637
4638 info->time_defined = 1;
4639 info->time.year = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4640 info->time.month = data[2];
4641 info->time.day = data[3];
4642 info->time.hour = data[4];
4643 info->time.minute = data[5];
4644 info->time.second = data[6];
4645
4646 return 0; /* OK */
4647}
4648
4649static unsigned readChunk_pHYs(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4650 if(chunkLength != 9) return 74; /*invalid pHYs chunk size*/
4651
4652 info->phys_defined = 1;
4653 info->phys_x = 16777216u * data[0] + 65536u * data[1] + 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4654 info->phys_y = 16777216u * data[4] + 65536u * data[5] + 256u * data[6] + data[7];
4655 info->phys_unit = data[8];
4656
4657 return 0; /* OK */
4658}
4659
4660static unsigned readChunk_gAMA(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4661 if(chunkLength != 4) return 96; /*invalid gAMA chunk size*/
4662
4663 info->gama_defined = 1;
4664 info->gama_gamma = 16777216u * data[0] + 65536u * data[1] + 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4665
4666 return 0; /* OK */
4667}
4668
4669static unsigned readChunk_cHRM(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4670 if(chunkLength != 32) return 97; /*invalid cHRM chunk size*/
4671
4672 info->chrm_defined = 1;
4673 info->chrm_white_x = 16777216u * data[ 0] + 65536u * data[ 1] + 256u * data[ 2] + data[ 3];
4674 info->chrm_white_y = 16777216u * data[ 4] + 65536u * data[ 5] + 256u * data[ 6] + data[ 7];
4675 info->chrm_red_x = 16777216u * data[ 8] + 65536u * data[ 9] + 256u * data[10] + data[11];
4676 info->chrm_red_y = 16777216u * data[12] + 65536u * data[13] + 256u * data[14] + data[15];
4677 info->chrm_green_x = 16777216u * data[16] + 65536u * data[17] + 256u * data[18] + data[19];
4678 info->chrm_green_y = 16777216u * data[20] + 65536u * data[21] + 256u * data[22] + data[23];
4679 info->chrm_blue_x = 16777216u * data[24] + 65536u * data[25] + 256u * data[26] + data[27];
4680 info->chrm_blue_y = 16777216u * data[28] + 65536u * data[29] + 256u * data[30] + data[31];
4681
4682 return 0; /* OK */
4683}
4684
4685static unsigned readChunk_sRGB(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4686 if(chunkLength != 1) return 98; /*invalid sRGB chunk size (this one is never ignored)*/
4687
4688 info->srgb_defined = 1;
4689 info->srgb_intent = data[0];
4690
4691 return 0; /* OK */
4692}
4693
4694static unsigned readChunk_iCCP(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecoderSettings* decoder,
4695 const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4696 unsigned error = 0;
4697 unsigned i;
4698 size_t size = 0;
4699 /*copy the object to change parameters in it*/
4700 LodePNGDecompressSettings zlibsettings = decoder->zlibsettings;
4701
4702 unsigned length, string2_begin;
4703
4704 info->iccp_defined = 1;
4705 if(info->iccp_name) lodepng_clear_icc(info);
4706
4707 for(length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length) ;
4708 if(length + 2 >= chunkLength) return 75; /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4709 if(length < 1 || length > 79) return 89; /*keyword too short or long*/
4710
4711 info->iccp_name = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4712 if(!info->iccp_name) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
4713
4714 info->iccp_name[length] = 0;
4715 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) info->iccp_name[i] = (char)data[i];
4716
4717 if(data[length + 1] != 0) return 72; /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4718
4719 string2_begin = length + 2;
4720 if(string2_begin > chunkLength) return 75; /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4721
4722 length = (unsigned)chunkLength - string2_begin;
4723 zlibsettings.max_output_size = decoder->max_icc_size;
4724 error = zlib_decompress(&info->iccp_profile, &size, 0,
4725 &data[string2_begin],
4726 length, &zlibsettings);
4727 /*error: ICC profile larger than decoder->max_icc_size*/
4728 if(error && size > zlibsettings.max_output_size) error = 113;
4729 info->iccp_profile_size = size;
4730 if(!error && !info->iccp_profile_size) error = 100; /*invalid ICC profile size*/
4731 return error;
4732}
4733
4734/*significant bits chunk (sBIT)*/
4735static unsigned readChunk_sBIT(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4736 unsigned bitdepth = (info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) ? 8 : info->color.bitdepth;
4737 if(info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY) {
4738 /*error: this chunk must be 1 bytes for grayscale image*/
4739 if(chunkLength != 1) return 114;
4740 if(data[0] == 0 || data[0] > bitdepth) return 115;
4741 info->sbit_defined = 1;
4742 info->sbit_r = info->sbit_g = info->sbit_b = data[0]; /*setting g and b is not required, but sensible*/
4743 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
4744 /*error: this chunk must be 3 bytes for RGB and palette image*/
4745 if(chunkLength != 3) return 114;
4746 if(data[0] == 0 || data[1] == 0 || data[2] == 0) return 115;
4747 if(data[0] > bitdepth || data[1] > bitdepth || data[2] > bitdepth) return 115;
4748 info->sbit_defined = 1;
4749 info->sbit_r = data[0];
4750 info->sbit_g = data[1];
4751 info->sbit_b = data[2];
4752 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
4753 /*error: this chunk must be 2 byte for grayscale with alpha image*/
4754 if(chunkLength != 2) return 114;
4755 if(data[0] == 0 || data[1] == 0) return 115;
4756 if(data[0] > bitdepth || data[1] > bitdepth) return 115;
4757 info->sbit_defined = 1;
4758 info->sbit_r = info->sbit_g = info->sbit_b = data[0]; /*setting g and b is not required, but sensible*/
4759 info->sbit_a = data[1];
4760 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
4761 /*error: this chunk must be 4 bytes for grayscale image*/
4762 if(chunkLength != 4) return 114;
4763 if(data[0] == 0 || data[1] == 0 || data[2] == 0 || data[3] == 0) return 115;
4764 if(data[0] > bitdepth || data[1] > bitdepth || data[2] > bitdepth || data[3] > bitdepth) return 115;
4765 info->sbit_defined = 1;
4766 info->sbit_r = data[0];
4767 info->sbit_g = data[1];
4768 info->sbit_b = data[2];
4769 info->sbit_a = data[3];
4770 }
4771
4772 return 0; /* OK */
4773}
4774#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4775
4776unsigned lodepng_inspect_chunk(LodePNGState* state, size_t pos,
4777 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
4778 const unsigned char* chunk = in + pos;
4779 unsigned chunkLength;
4780 const unsigned char* data;
4781 unsigned unhandled = 0;
4782 unsigned error = 0;
4783
4784 if(pos + 4 > insize) return 30;
4785 chunkLength = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
4786 if(chunkLength > 2147483647) return 63;
4787 data = lodepng_chunk_data_const(chunk);
4788 if(chunkLength + 12 > insize - pos) return 30;
4789
4790 if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "PLTE")) {
4791 error = readChunk_PLTE(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4792 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tRNS")) {
4793 error = readChunk_tRNS(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4794#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4795 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "bKGD")) {
4796 error = readChunk_bKGD(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4797 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tEXt")) {
4798 error = readChunk_tEXt(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4799 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "zTXt")) {
4800 error = readChunk_zTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder, data, chunkLength);
4801 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iTXt")) {
4802 error = readChunk_iTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder, data, chunkLength);
4803 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tIME")) {
4804 error = readChunk_tIME(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4805 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "pHYs")) {
4806 error = readChunk_pHYs(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4807 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "gAMA")) {
4808 error = readChunk_gAMA(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4809 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "cHRM")) {
4810 error = readChunk_cHRM(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4811 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "sRGB")) {
4812 error = readChunk_sRGB(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4813 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iCCP")) {
4814 error = readChunk_iCCP(&state->info_png, &state->decoder, data, chunkLength);
4815 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "sBIT")) {
4816 error = readChunk_sBIT(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4817#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4818 } else {
4819 /* unhandled chunk is ok (is not an error) */
4820 unhandled = 1;
4821 }
4822
4823 if(!error && !unhandled && !state->decoder.ignore_crc) {
4824 if(lodepng_chunk_check_crc(chunk)) return 57; /*invalid CRC*/
4825 }
4826
4827 return error;
4828}
4829
4830/*read a PNG, the result will be in the same color type as the PNG (hence "generic")*/
4831static void decodeGeneric(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h,
4832 LodePNGState* state,
4833 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
4834 unsigned char IEND = 0;
4835 const unsigned char* chunk; /*points to beginning of next chunk*/
4836 unsigned char* idat; /*the data from idat chunks, zlib compressed*/
4837 size_t idatsize = 0;
4838 unsigned char* scanlines = 0;
4839 size_t scanlines_size = 0, expected_size = 0;
4840 size_t outsize = 0;
4841
4842 /*for unknown chunk order*/
4843 unsigned unknown = 0;
4844#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4845 unsigned critical_pos = 1; /*1 = after IHDR, 2 = after PLTE, 3 = after IDAT*/
4846#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4847
4848
4849 /* safe output values in case error happens */
4850 *out = 0;
4851 *w = *h = 0;
4852
4853 state->error = lodepng_inspect(w, h, state, in, insize); /*reads header and resets other parameters in state->info_png*/
4854 if(state->error) return;
4855
4856 if(lodepng_pixel_overflow(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color, &state->info_raw)) {
4857 CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 92); /*overflow possible due to amount of pixels*/
4858 }
4859
4860 /*the input filesize is a safe upper bound for the sum of idat chunks size*/
4861 idat = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(insize);
4862 if(!idat) CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4863
4864 chunk = &in[33]; /*first byte of the first chunk after the header*/
4865
4866 /*loop through the chunks, ignoring unknown chunks and stopping at IEND chunk.
4867 IDAT data is put at the start of the in buffer*/
4868 while(!IEND && !state->error) {
4869 unsigned chunkLength;
4870 const unsigned char* data; /*the data in the chunk*/
4871 size_t pos = (size_t)(chunk - in);
4872
4873 /*error: next chunk out of bounds of the in buffer*/
4874 if(chunk < in || pos + 12 > insize) {
4875 if(state->decoder.ignore_end) break; /*other errors may still happen though*/
4876 CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 30);
4877 }
4878
4879 /*length of the data of the chunk, excluding the 12 bytes for length, chunk type and CRC*/
4880 chunkLength = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
4881 /*error: chunk length larger than the max PNG chunk size*/
4882 if(chunkLength > 2147483647) {
4883 if(state->decoder.ignore_end) break; /*other errors may still happen though*/
4884 CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 63);
4885 }
4886
4887 if(pos + (size_t)chunkLength + 12 > insize || pos + (size_t)chunkLength + 12 < pos) {
4888 CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 64); /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk (or int overflow)*/
4889 }
4890
4891 data = lodepng_chunk_data_const(chunk);
4892
4893 unknown = 0;
4894
4895 /*IDAT chunk, containing compressed image data*/
4896 if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IDAT")) {
4897 size_t newsize;
4898 if(lodepng_addofl(idatsize, chunkLength, &newsize)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 95);
4899 if(newsize > insize) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 95);
4900 lodepng_memcpy(idat + idatsize, data, chunkLength);
4901 idatsize += chunkLength;
4902#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4903 critical_pos = 3;
4904#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4905 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IEND")) {
4906 /*IEND chunk*/
4907 IEND = 1;
4908 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "PLTE")) {
4909 /*palette chunk (PLTE)*/
4910 state->error = readChunk_PLTE(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4911 if(state->error) break;
4912#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4913 critical_pos = 2;
4914#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4915 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tRNS")) {
4916 /*palette transparency chunk (tRNS). Even though this one is an ancillary chunk , it is still compiled
4917 in without 'LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS' because it contains essential color information that
4918 affects the alpha channel of pixels. */
4919 state->error = readChunk_tRNS(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4920 if(state->error) break;
4921#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4922 /*background color chunk (bKGD)*/
4923 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "bKGD")) {
4924 state->error = readChunk_bKGD(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4925 if(state->error) break;
4926 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tEXt")) {
4927 /*text chunk (tEXt)*/
4928 if(state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4929 state->error = readChunk_tEXt(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4930 if(state->error) break;
4931 }
4932 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "zTXt")) {
4933 /*compressed text chunk (zTXt)*/
4934 if(state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4935 state->error = readChunk_zTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder, data, chunkLength);
4936 if(state->error) break;
4937 }
4938 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iTXt")) {
4939 /*international text chunk (iTXt)*/
4940 if(state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4941 state->error = readChunk_iTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder, data, chunkLength);
4942 if(state->error) break;
4943 }
4944 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tIME")) {
4945 state->error = readChunk_tIME(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4946 if(state->error) break;
4947 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "pHYs")) {
4948 state->error = readChunk_pHYs(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4949 if(state->error) break;
4950 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "gAMA")) {
4951 state->error = readChunk_gAMA(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4952 if(state->error) break;
4953 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "cHRM")) {
4954 state->error = readChunk_cHRM(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4955 if(state->error) break;
4956 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "sRGB")) {
4957 state->error = readChunk_sRGB(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4958 if(state->error) break;
4959 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iCCP")) {
4960 state->error = readChunk_iCCP(&state->info_png, &state->decoder, data, chunkLength);
4961 if(state->error) break;
4962 } else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "sBIT")) {
4963 state->error = readChunk_sBIT(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4964 if(state->error) break;
4965#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4966 } else /*it's not an implemented chunk type, so ignore it: skip over the data*/ {
4967 /*error: unknown critical chunk (5th bit of first byte of chunk type is 0)*/
4968 if(!state->decoder.ignore_critical && !lodepng_chunk_ancillary(chunk)) {
4969 CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 69);
4970 }
4971
4972 unknown = 1;
4973#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4974 if(state->decoder.remember_unknown_chunks) {
4975 state->error = lodepng_chunk_append(&state->info_png.unknown_chunks_data[critical_pos - 1],
4976 &state->info_png.unknown_chunks_size[critical_pos - 1], chunk);
4977 if(state->error) break;
4978 }
4979#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4980 }
4981
4982 if(!state->decoder.ignore_crc && !unknown) /*check CRC if wanted, only on known chunk types*/ {
4983 if(lodepng_chunk_check_crc(chunk)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
4984 }
4985
4986 if(!IEND) chunk = lodepng_chunk_next_const(chunk, in + insize);
4987 }
4988
4989 if(!state->error && state->info_png.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE && !state->info_png.color.palette) {
4990 state->error = 106; /* error: PNG file must have PLTE chunk if color type is palette */
4991 }
4992
4993 if(!state->error) {
4994 /*predict output size, to allocate exact size for output buffer to avoid more dynamic allocation.
4995 If the decompressed size does not match the prediction, the image must be corrupt.*/
4996 if(state->info_png.interlace_method == 0) {
4997 size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&state->info_png.color);
4998 expected_size = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(*w, *h, bpp);
4999 } else {
5000 size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&state->info_png.color);
5001 /*Adam-7 interlaced: expected size is the sum of the 7 sub-images sizes*/
5002 expected_size = 0;
5003 expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 7) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, bpp);
5004 if(*w > 4) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, bpp);
5005 expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 3, bpp);
5006 if(*w > 2) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 2, bpp);
5007 expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 2, bpp);
5008 if(*w > 1) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 1, bpp);
5009 expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0), (*h + 0) >> 1, bpp);
5010 }
5011
5012 state->error = zlib_decompress(&scanlines, &scanlines_size, expected_size, idat, idatsize, &state->decoder.zlibsettings);
5013 }
5014 if(!state->error && scanlines_size != expected_size) state->error = 91; /*decompressed size doesn't match prediction*/
5015 lodepng_free(idat);
5016
5017 if(!state->error) {
5018 outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color);
5019 *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
5020 if(!*out) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5021 }
5022 if(!state->error) {
5023 lodepng_memset(*out, 0, outsize);
5024 state->error = postProcessScanlines(*out, scanlines, *w, *h, &state->info_png);
5025 }
5026 lodepng_free(scanlines);
5027}
5028
5029unsigned lodepng_decode(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h,
5030 LodePNGState* state,
5031 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
5032 *out = 0;
5033 decodeGeneric(out, w, h, state, in, insize);
5034 if(state->error) return state->error;
5035 if(!state->decoder.color_convert || lodepng_color_mode_equal(&state->info_raw, &state->info_png.color)) {
5036 /*same color type, no copying or converting of data needed*/
5037 /*store the info_png color settings on the info_raw so that the info_raw still reflects what colortype
5038 the raw image has to the end user*/
5039 if(!state->decoder.color_convert) {
5040 state->error = lodepng_color_mode_copy(&state->info_raw, &state->info_png.color);
5041 if(state->error) return state->error;
5042 }
5043 } else { /*color conversion needed*/
5044 unsigned char* data = *out;
5045 size_t outsize;
5046
5047 /*TODO: check if this works according to the statement in the documentation: "The converter can convert
5048 from grayscale input color type, to 8-bit grayscale or grayscale with alpha"*/
5049 if(!(state->info_raw.colortype == LCT_RGB || state->info_raw.colortype == LCT_RGBA)
5050 && !(state->info_raw.bitdepth == 8)) {
5051 return 56; /*unsupported color mode conversion*/
5052 }
5053
5054 outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_raw);
5055 *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
5056 if(!(*out)) {
5057 state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5058 }
5059 else state->error = lodepng_convert(*out, data, &state->info_raw,
5060 &state->info_png.color, *w, *h);
5061 lodepng_free(data);
5062 }
5063 return state->error;
5064}
5065
5066unsigned lodepng_decode_memory(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in,
5067 size_t insize, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
5068 unsigned error;
5069 LodePNGState state;
5070 lodepng_state_init(&state);
5071 state.info_raw.colortype = colortype;
5072 state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
5073#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5074 /*disable reading things that this function doesn't output*/
5075 state.decoder.read_text_chunks = 0;
5076 state.decoder.remember_unknown_chunks = 0;
5077#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5078 error = lodepng_decode(out, w, h, &state, in, insize);
5079 lodepng_state_cleanup(&state);
5080 return error;
5081}
5082
5083unsigned lodepng_decode32(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
5084 return lodepng_decode_memory(out, w, h, in, insize, LCT_RGBA, 8);
5085}
5086
5087unsigned lodepng_decode24(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
5088 return lodepng_decode_memory(out, w, h, in, insize, LCT_RGB, 8);
5089}
5090
5091#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
5092unsigned lodepng_decode_file(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const char* filename,
5093 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
5094 unsigned char* buffer = 0;
5095 size_t buffersize;
5096 unsigned error;
5097 /* safe output values in case error happens */
5098 *out = 0;
5099 *w = *h = 0;
5100 error = lodepng_load_file(&buffer, &buffersize, filename);
5101 if(!error) error = lodepng_decode_memory(out, w, h, buffer, buffersize, colortype, bitdepth);
5102 lodepng_free(buffer);
5103 return error;
5104}
5105
5106unsigned lodepng_decode32_file(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const char* filename) {
5107 return lodepng_decode_file(out, w, h, filename, LCT_RGBA, 8);
5108}
5109
5110unsigned lodepng_decode24_file(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const char* filename) {
5111 return lodepng_decode_file(out, w, h, filename, LCT_RGB, 8);
5112}
5113#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK*/
5114
5115void lodepng_decoder_settings_init(LodePNGDecoderSettings* settings) {
5116 settings->color_convert = 1;
5117#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5118 settings->read_text_chunks = 1;
5119 settings->remember_unknown_chunks = 0;
5120 settings->max_text_size = 16777216;
5121 settings->max_icc_size = 16777216; /* 16MB is much more than enough for any reasonable ICC profile */
5122#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5123 settings->ignore_crc = 0;
5124 settings->ignore_critical = 0;
5125 settings->ignore_end = 0;
5126 lodepng_decompress_settings_init(&settings->zlibsettings);
5127}
5128
5129#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
5130
5131#if defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER) || defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER)
5132
5133void lodepng_state_init(LodePNGState* state) {
5134#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
5135 lodepng_decoder_settings_init(&state->decoder);
5136#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
5137#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
5138 lodepng_encoder_settings_init(&state->encoder);
5139#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
5140 lodepng_color_mode_init(&state->info_raw);
5141 lodepng_info_init(&state->info_png);
5142 state->error = 1;
5143}
5144
5145void lodepng_state_cleanup(LodePNGState* state) {
5146 lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&state->info_raw);
5147 lodepng_info_cleanup(&state->info_png);
5148}
5149
5150void lodepng_state_copy(LodePNGState* dest, const LodePNGState* source) {
5151 lodepng_state_cleanup(dest);
5152 *dest = *source;
5153 lodepng_color_mode_init(&dest->info_raw);
5154 lodepng_info_init(&dest->info_png);
5155 dest->error = lodepng_color_mode_copy(&dest->info_raw, &source->info_raw); if(dest->error) return;
5156 dest->error = lodepng_info_copy(&dest->info_png, &source->info_png); if(dest->error) return;
5157}
5158
5159#endif /* defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER) || defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER) */
5160
5161#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
5162
5163/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
5164/* / PNG Encoder / */
5165/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
5166
5167
5168static unsigned writeSignature(ucvector* out) {
5169 size_t pos = out->size;
5170 const unsigned char signature[] = {137, 80, 78, 71, 13, 10, 26, 10};
5171 /*8 bytes PNG signature, aka the magic bytes*/
5172 if(!ucvector_resize(out, out->size + 8)) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
5173 lodepng_memcpy(out->data + pos, signature, 8);
5174 return 0;
5175}
5176
5177static unsigned addChunk_IHDR(ucvector* out, unsigned w, unsigned h,
5178 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth, unsigned interlace_method) {
5179 unsigned char *chunk, *data;
5180 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 13, "IHDR"));
5181 data = chunk + 8;
5182
5183 lodepng_set32bitInt(data + 0, w); /*width*/
5184 lodepng_set32bitInt(data + 4, h); /*height*/
5185 data[8] = (unsigned char)bitdepth; /*bit depth*/
5186 data[9] = (unsigned char)colortype; /*color type*/
5187 data[10] = 0; /*compression method*/
5188 data[11] = 0; /*filter method*/
5189 data[12] = interlace_method; /*interlace method*/
5190
5191 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5192 return 0;
5193}
5194
5195/* only adds the chunk if needed (there is a key or palette with alpha) */
5196static unsigned addChunk_PLTE(ucvector* out, const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
5197 unsigned char* chunk;
5198 size_t i, j = 8;
5199
5200 if(info->palettesize == 0 || info->palettesize > 256) {
5201 return 68; /*invalid palette size, it is only allowed to be 1-256*/
5202 }
5203
5204 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, info->palettesize * 3, "PLTE"));
5205
5206 for(i = 0; i != info->palettesize; ++i) {
5207 /*add all channels except alpha channel*/
5208 chunk[j++] = info->palette[i * 4 + 0];
5209 chunk[j++] = info->palette[i * 4 + 1];
5210 chunk[j++] = info->palette[i * 4 + 2];
5211 }
5212
5213 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5214 return 0;
5215}
5216
5217static unsigned addChunk_tRNS(ucvector* out, const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
5218 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5219
5220 if(info->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
5221 size_t i, amount = info->palettesize;
5222 /*the tail of palette values that all have 255 as alpha, does not have to be encoded*/
5223 for(i = info->palettesize; i != 0; --i) {
5224 if(info->palette[4 * (i - 1) + 3] != 255) break;
5225 --amount;
5226 }
5227 if(amount) {
5228 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, amount, "tRNS"));
5229 /*add the alpha channel values from the palette*/
5230 for(i = 0; i != amount; ++i) chunk[8 + i] = info->palette[4 * i + 3];
5231 }
5232 } else if(info->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
5233 if(info->key_defined) {
5234 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 2, "tRNS"));
5235 chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r >> 8);
5236 chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r & 255);
5237 }
5238 } else if(info->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
5239 if(info->key_defined) {
5240 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 6, "tRNS"));
5241 chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r >> 8);
5242 chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r & 255);
5243 chunk[10] = (unsigned char)(info->key_g >> 8);
5244 chunk[11] = (unsigned char)(info->key_g & 255);
5245 chunk[12] = (unsigned char)(info->key_b >> 8);
5246 chunk[13] = (unsigned char)(info->key_b & 255);
5247 }
5248 }
5249
5250 if(chunk) lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5251 return 0;
5252}
5253
5254static unsigned addChunk_IDAT(ucvector* out, const unsigned char* data, size_t datasize,
5255 LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5256 unsigned error = 0;
5257 unsigned char* zlib = 0;
5258 size_t zlibsize = 0;
5259
5260 error = zlib_compress(&zlib, &zlibsize, data, datasize, zlibsettings);
5261 if(!error) {
5262 error = lodepng_chunk_createv(out, zlibsize, "IDAT", zlib);
5263 }
5264 lodepng_free(zlib);
5265 return error;
5266}
5267
5268static unsigned addChunk_IEND(ucvector* out) {
5269 return lodepng_chunk_createv(out, 0, "IEND", 0);
5270}
5271
5272#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5273
5274static unsigned addChunk_tEXt(ucvector* out, const char* keyword, const char* textstring) {
5275 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5276 size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(keyword), textsize = lodepng_strlen(textstring);
5277 size_t size = keysize + 1 + textsize;
5278 if(keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5279 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "tEXt"));
5280 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, keyword, keysize);
5281 chunk[8 + keysize] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5282 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 9 + keysize, textstring, textsize);
5283 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5284 return 0;
5285}
5286
5287static unsigned addChunk_zTXt(ucvector* out, const char* keyword, const char* textstring,
5288 LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5289 unsigned error = 0;
5290 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5291 unsigned char* compressed = 0;
5292 size_t compressedsize = 0;
5293 size_t textsize = lodepng_strlen(textstring);
5294 size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(keyword);
5295 if(keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5296
5297 error = zlib_compress(&compressed, &compressedsize,
5298 (const unsigned char*)textstring, textsize, zlibsettings);
5299 if(!error) {
5300 size_t size = keysize + 2 + compressedsize;
5301 error = lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "zTXt");
5302 }
5303 if(!error) {
5304 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, keyword, keysize);
5305 chunk[8 + keysize] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5306 chunk[9 + keysize] = 0; /*compression method: 0*/
5307 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 10 + keysize, compressed, compressedsize);
5308 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5309 }
5310
5311 lodepng_free(compressed);
5312 return error;
5313}
5314
5315static unsigned addChunk_iTXt(ucvector* out, unsigned compress, const char* keyword, const char* langtag,
5316 const char* transkey, const char* textstring, LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5317 unsigned error = 0;
5318 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5319 unsigned char* compressed = 0;
5320 size_t compressedsize = 0;
5321 size_t textsize = lodepng_strlen(textstring);
5322 size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(keyword), langsize = lodepng_strlen(langtag), transsize = lodepng_strlen(transkey);
5323
5324 if(keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5325
5326 if(compress) {
5327 error = zlib_compress(&compressed, &compressedsize,
5328 (const unsigned char*)textstring, textsize, zlibsettings);
5329 }
5330 if(!error) {
5331 size_t size = keysize + 3 + langsize + 1 + transsize + 1 + (compress ? compressedsize : textsize);
5332 error = lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "iTXt");
5333 }
5334 if(!error) {
5335 size_t pos = 8;
5336 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, keyword, keysize);
5337 pos += keysize;
5338 chunk[pos++] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5339 chunk[pos++] = (compress ? 1 : 0); /*compression flag*/
5340 chunk[pos++] = 0; /*compression method: 0*/
5341 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, langtag, langsize);
5342 pos += langsize;
5343 chunk[pos++] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5344 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, transkey, transsize);
5345 pos += transsize;
5346 chunk[pos++] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5347 if(compress) {
5348 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, compressed, compressedsize);
5349 } else {
5350 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, textstring, textsize);
5351 }
5352 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5353 }
5354
5355 lodepng_free(compressed);
5356 return error;
5357}
5358
5359static unsigned addChunk_bKGD(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5360 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5361 if(info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
5362 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 2, "bKGD"));
5363 chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r >> 8);
5364 chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r & 255);
5365 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info->color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
5366 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 6, "bKGD"));
5367 chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r >> 8);
5368 chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r & 255);
5369 chunk[10] = (unsigned char)(info->background_g >> 8);
5370 chunk[11] = (unsigned char)(info->background_g & 255);
5371 chunk[12] = (unsigned char)(info->background_b >> 8);
5372 chunk[13] = (unsigned char)(info->background_b & 255);
5373 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
5374 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 1, "bKGD"));
5375 chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r & 255); /*palette index*/
5376 }
5377 if(chunk) lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5378 return 0;
5379}
5380
5381static unsigned addChunk_tIME(ucvector* out, const LodePNGTime* time) {
5382 unsigned char* chunk;
5383 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 7, "tIME"));
5384 chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(time->year >> 8);
5385 chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(time->year & 255);
5386 chunk[10] = (unsigned char)time->month;
5387 chunk[11] = (unsigned char)time->day;
5388 chunk[12] = (unsigned char)time->hour;
5389 chunk[13] = (unsigned char)time->minute;
5390 chunk[14] = (unsigned char)time->second;
5391 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5392 return 0;
5393}
5394
5395static unsigned addChunk_pHYs(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5396 unsigned char* chunk;
5397 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 9, "pHYs"));
5398 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8, info->phys_x);
5399 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 12, info->phys_y);
5400 chunk[16] = info->phys_unit;
5401 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5402 return 0;
5403}
5404
5405static unsigned addChunk_gAMA(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5406 unsigned char* chunk;
5407 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 4, "gAMA"));
5408 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8, info->gama_gamma);
5409 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5410 return 0;
5411}
5412
5413static unsigned addChunk_cHRM(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5414 unsigned char* chunk;
5415 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 32, "cHRM"));
5416 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8, info->chrm_white_x);
5417 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 12, info->chrm_white_y);
5418 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 16, info->chrm_red_x);
5419 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 20, info->chrm_red_y);
5420 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 24, info->chrm_green_x);
5421 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 28, info->chrm_green_y);
5422 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 32, info->chrm_blue_x);
5423 lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 36, info->chrm_blue_y);
5424 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5425 return 0;
5426}
5427
5428static unsigned addChunk_sRGB(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5429 unsigned char data = info->srgb_intent;
5430 return lodepng_chunk_createv(out, 1, "sRGB", &data);
5431}
5432
5433static unsigned addChunk_iCCP(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info, LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5434 unsigned error = 0;
5435 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5436 unsigned char* compressed = 0;
5437 size_t compressedsize = 0;
5438 size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(info->iccp_name);
5439
5440 if(keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5441 error = zlib_compress(&compressed, &compressedsize,
5442 info->iccp_profile, info->iccp_profile_size, zlibsettings);
5443 if(!error) {
5444 size_t size = keysize + 2 + compressedsize;
5445 error = lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "iCCP");
5446 }
5447 if(!error) {
5448 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, info->iccp_name, keysize);
5449 chunk[8 + keysize] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5450 chunk[9 + keysize] = 0; /*compression method: 0*/
5451 lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 10 + keysize, compressed, compressedsize);
5452 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5453 }
5454
5455 lodepng_free(compressed);
5456 return error;
5457}
5458
5459static unsigned addChunk_sBIT(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5460 unsigned bitdepth = (info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) ? 8 : info->color.bitdepth;
5461 unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5462 if(info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY) {
5463 if(info->sbit_r == 0 || info->sbit_r > bitdepth) return 115;
5464 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 1, "sBIT"));
5465 chunk[8] = info->sbit_r;
5466 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
5467 if(info->sbit_r == 0 || info->sbit_g == 0 || info->sbit_b == 0) return 115;
5468 if(info->sbit_r > bitdepth || info->sbit_g > bitdepth || info->sbit_b > bitdepth) return 115;
5469 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 3, "sBIT"));
5470 chunk[8] = info->sbit_r;
5471 chunk[9] = info->sbit_g;
5472 chunk[10] = info->sbit_b;
5473 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
5474 if(info->sbit_r == 0 || info->sbit_a == 0) return 115;
5475 if(info->sbit_r > bitdepth || info->sbit_a > bitdepth) return 115;
5476 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 2, "sBIT"));
5477 chunk[8] = info->sbit_r;
5478 chunk[9] = info->sbit_a;
5479 } else if(info->color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
5480 if(info->sbit_r == 0 || info->sbit_g == 0 || info->sbit_b == 0 || info->sbit_a == 0 ||
5481 info->sbit_r > bitdepth || info->sbit_g > bitdepth ||
5482 info->sbit_b > bitdepth || info->sbit_a > bitdepth) {
5483 return 115;
5484 }
5485 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 4, "sBIT"));
5486 chunk[8] = info->sbit_r;
5487 chunk[9] = info->sbit_g;
5488 chunk[10] = info->sbit_b;
5489 chunk[11] = info->sbit_a;
5490 }
5491 if(chunk) lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5492 return 0;
5493}
5494
5495#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5496
5497static void filterScanline(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* scanline, const unsigned char* prevline,
5498 size_t length, size_t bytewidth, unsigned char filterType) {
5499 size_t i;
5500 switch(filterType) {
5501 case 0: /*None*/
5502 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5503 break;
5504 case 1: /*Sub*/
5505 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5506 for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - scanline[i - bytewidth];
5507 break;
5508 case 2: /*Up*/
5509 if(prevline) {
5510 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - prevline[i];
5511 } else {
5512 for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5513 }
5514 break;
5515 case 3: /*Average*/
5516 if(prevline) {
5517 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - (prevline[i] >> 1);
5518 for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - ((scanline[i - bytewidth] + prevline[i]) >> 1);
5519 } else {
5520 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5521 for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - (scanline[i - bytewidth] >> 1);
5522 }
5523 break;
5524 case 4: /*Paeth*/
5525 if(prevline) {
5526 /*paethPredictor(0, prevline[i], 0) is always prevline[i]*/
5527 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = (scanline[i] - prevline[i]);
5528 for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) {
5529 out[i] = (scanline[i] - paethPredictor(scanline[i - bytewidth], prevline[i], prevline[i - bytewidth]));
5530 }
5531 } else {
5532 for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5533 /*paethPredictor(scanline[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always scanline[i - bytewidth]*/
5534 for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = (scanline[i] - scanline[i - bytewidth]);
5535 }
5536 break;
5537 default: return; /*invalid filter type given*/
5538 }
5539}
5540
5541/* integer binary logarithm, max return value is 31 */
5542static size_t ilog2(size_t i) {
5543 size_t result = 0;
5544 if(i >= 65536) { result += 16; i >>= 16; }
5545 if(i >= 256) { result += 8; i >>= 8; }
5546 if(i >= 16) { result += 4; i >>= 4; }
5547 if(i >= 4) { result += 2; i >>= 2; }
5548 if(i >= 2) { result += 1; /*i >>= 1;*/ }
5549 return result;
5550}
5551
5552/* integer approximation for i * log2(i), helper function for LFS_ENTROPY */
5553static size_t ilog2i(size_t i) {
5554 size_t l;
5555 if(i == 0) return 0;
5556 l = ilog2(i);
5557 /* approximate i*log2(i): l is integer logarithm, ((i - (1u << l)) << 1u)
5558 linearly approximates the missing fractional part multiplied by i */
5559 return i * l + ((i - (1u << l)) << 1u);
5560}
5561
5562static unsigned filter(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
5563 const LodePNGColorMode* color, const LodePNGEncoderSettings* settings) {
5564 /*
5565 For PNG filter method 0
5566 out must be a buffer with as size: h + (w * h * bpp + 7u) / 8u, because there are
5567 the scanlines with 1 extra byte per scanline
5568 */
5569
5570 unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(color);
5571 /*the width of a scanline in bytes, not including the filter type*/
5572 size_t linebytes = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(w, 1, bpp) - 1u;
5573
5574 /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
5575 size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7u) / 8u;
5576 const unsigned char* prevline = 0;
5577 unsigned x, y;
5578 unsigned error = 0;
5579 LodePNGFilterStrategy strategy = settings->filter_strategy;
5580
5581 /*
5582 There is a heuristic called the minimum sum of absolute differences heuristic, suggested by the PNG standard:
5583 * If the image type is Palette, or the bit depth is smaller than 8, then do not filter the image (i.e.
5584 use fixed filtering, with the filter None).
5585 * (The other case) If the image type is Grayscale or RGB (with or without Alpha), and the bit depth is
5586 not smaller than 8, then use adaptive filtering heuristic as follows: independently for each row, apply
5587 all five filters and select the filter that produces the smallest sum of absolute values per row.
5588 This heuristic is used if filter strategy is LFS_MINSUM and filter_palette_zero is true.
5589
5590 If filter_palette_zero is true and filter_strategy is not LFS_MINSUM, the above heuristic is followed,
5591 but for "the other case", whatever strategy filter_strategy is set to instead of the minimum sum
5592 heuristic is used.
5593 */
5594 if(settings->filter_palette_zero &&
5595 (color->colortype == LCT_PALETTE || color->bitdepth < 8)) strategy = LFS_ZERO;
5596
5597 if(bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid color type*/
5598
5599 if(strategy >= LFS_ZERO && strategy <= LFS_FOUR) {
5600 unsigned char type = (unsigned char)strategy;
5601 for(y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5602 size_t outindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
5603 size_t inindex = linebytes * y;
5604 out[outindex] = type; /*filter type byte*/
5605 filterScanline(&out[outindex + 1], &in[inindex], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5606 prevline = &in[inindex];
5607 }
5608 } else if(strategy == LFS_MINSUM) {
5609 /*adaptive filtering*/
5610 unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5611 size_t smallest = 0;
5612 unsigned char type, bestType = 0;
5613
5614 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5615 attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5616 if(!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5617 }
5618
5619 if(!error) {
5620 for(y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5621 /*try the 5 filter types*/
5622 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5623 size_t sum = 0;
5624 filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5625
5626 /*calculate the sum of the result*/
5627 if(type == 0) {
5628 for(x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) sum += (unsigned char)(attempt[type][x]);
5629 } else {
5630 for(x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) {
5631 /*For differences, each byte should be treated as signed, values above 127 are negative
5632 (converted to signed char). Filtertype 0 isn't a difference though, so use unsigned there.
5633 This means filtertype 0 is almost never chosen, but that is justified.*/
5634 unsigned char s = attempt[type][x];
5635 sum += s < 128 ? s : (255U - s);
5636 }
5637 }
5638
5639 /*check if this is smallest sum (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5640 if(type == 0 || sum < smallest) {
5641 bestType = type;
5642 smallest = sum;
5643 }
5644 }
5645
5646 prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5647
5648 /*now fill the out values*/
5649 out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5650 for(x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5651 }
5652 }
5653
5654 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5655 } else if(strategy == LFS_ENTROPY) {
5656 unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5657 size_t bestSum = 0;
5658 unsigned type, bestType = 0;
5659 unsigned count[256];
5660
5661 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5662 attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5663 if(!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5664 }
5665
5666 if(!error) {
5667 for(y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5668 /*try the 5 filter types*/
5669 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5670 size_t sum = 0;
5671 filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5672 lodepng_memset(count, 0, 256 * sizeof(*count));
5673 for(x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) ++count[attempt[type][x]];
5674 ++count[type]; /*the filter type itself is part of the scanline*/
5675 for(x = 0; x != 256; ++x) {
5676 sum += ilog2i(count[x]);
5677 }
5678 /*check if this is smallest sum (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5679 if(type == 0 || sum > bestSum) {
5680 bestType = type;
5681 bestSum = sum;
5682 }
5683 }
5684
5685 prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5686
5687 /*now fill the out values*/
5688 out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5689 for(x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5690 }
5691 }
5692
5693 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5694 } else if(strategy == LFS_PREDEFINED) {
5695 for(y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5696 size_t outindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
5697 size_t inindex = linebytes * y;
5698 unsigned char type = settings->predefined_filters[y];
5699 out[outindex] = type; /*filter type byte*/
5700 filterScanline(&out[outindex + 1], &in[inindex], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5701 prevline = &in[inindex];
5702 }
5703 } else if(strategy == LFS_BRUTE_FORCE) {
5704 /*brute force filter chooser.
5705 deflate the scanline after every filter attempt to see which one deflates best.
5706 This is very slow and gives only slightly smaller, sometimes even larger, result*/
5707 size_t size[5];
5708 unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5709 size_t smallest = 0;
5710 unsigned type = 0, bestType = 0;
5711 unsigned char* dummy;
5712 LodePNGCompressSettings zlibsettings;
5713 lodepng_memcpy(&zlibsettings, &settings->zlibsettings, sizeof(LodePNGCompressSettings));
5714 /*use fixed tree on the attempts so that the tree is not adapted to the filtertype on purpose,
5715 to simulate the true case where the tree is the same for the whole image. Sometimes it gives
5716 better result with dynamic tree anyway. Using the fixed tree sometimes gives worse, but in rare
5717 cases better compression. It does make this a bit less slow, so it's worth doing this.*/
5718 zlibsettings.btype = 1;
5719 /*a custom encoder likely doesn't read the btype setting and is optimized for complete PNG
5720 images only, so disable it*/
5721 zlibsettings.custom_zlib = 0;
5722 zlibsettings.custom_deflate = 0;
5723 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5724 attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5725 if(!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5726 }
5727 if(!error) {
5728 for(y = 0; y != h; ++y) /*try the 5 filter types*/ {
5729 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5730 unsigned testsize = (unsigned)linebytes;
5731 /*if(testsize > 8) testsize /= 8;*/ /*it already works good enough by testing a part of the row*/
5732
5733 filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5734 size[type] = 0;
5735 dummy = 0;
5736 zlib_compress(&dummy, &size[type], attempt[type], testsize, &zlibsettings);
5737 lodepng_free(dummy);
5738 /*check if this is smallest size (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5739 if(type == 0 || size[type] < smallest) {
5740 bestType = type;
5741 smallest = size[type];
5742 }
5743 }
5744 prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5745 out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5746 for(x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5747 }
5748 }
5749 for(type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5750 }
5751 else return 88; /* unknown filter strategy */
5752
5753 return error;
5754}
5755
5756static void addPaddingBits(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
5757 size_t olinebits, size_t ilinebits, unsigned h) {
5758 /*The opposite of the removePaddingBits function
5759 olinebits must be >= ilinebits*/
5760 unsigned y;
5761 size_t diff = olinebits - ilinebits;
5762 size_t obp = 0, ibp = 0; /*bit pointers*/
5763 for(y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5764 size_t x;
5765 for(x = 0; x < ilinebits; ++x) {
5766 unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
5767 setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
5768 }
5769 /*obp += diff; --> no, fill in some value in the padding bits too, to avoid
5770 "Use of uninitialised value of size ###" warning from valgrind*/
5771 for(x = 0; x != diff; ++x) setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, 0);
5772 }
5773}
5774
5775/*
5776in: non-interlaced image with size w*h
5777out: the same pixels, but re-ordered according to PNG's Adam7 interlacing, with
5778 no padding bits between scanlines, but between reduced images so that each
5779 reduced image starts at a byte.
5780bpp: bits per pixel
5781there are no padding bits, not between scanlines, not between reduced images
5782in has the following size in bits: w * h * bpp.
5783out is possibly bigger due to padding bits between reduced images
5784NOTE: comments about padding bits are only relevant if bpp < 8
5785*/
5786static void Adam7_interlace(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
5787 unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
5788 size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
5789 unsigned i;
5790
5791 Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
5792
5793 if(bpp >= 8) {
5794 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5795 unsigned x, y, b;
5796 size_t bytewidth = bpp / 8u;
5797 for(y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
5798 for(x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
5799 size_t pixelinstart = ((ADAM7_IY[i] + y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * w + ADAM7_IX[i] + x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bytewidth;
5800 size_t pixeloutstart = passstart[i] + (y * passw[i] + x) * bytewidth;
5801 for(b = 0; b < bytewidth; ++b) {
5802 out[pixeloutstart + b] = in[pixelinstart + b];
5803 }
5804 }
5805 }
5806 } else /*bpp < 8: Adam7 with pixels < 8 bit is a bit trickier: with bit pointers*/ {
5807 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5808 unsigned x, y, b;
5809 unsigned ilinebits = bpp * passw[i];
5810 unsigned olinebits = bpp * w;
5811 size_t obp, ibp; /*bit pointers (for out and in buffer)*/
5812 for(y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
5813 for(x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
