5814 ibp = (ADAM7_IY[i] + y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * olinebits + (ADAM7_IX[i] + x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bpp;
5815 obp = (8 * passstart[i]) + (y * ilinebits + x * bpp);
5816 for(b = 0; b < bpp; ++b) {
5817 unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
5818 setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
5819 }
5820 }
5821 }
5822 }
5823}
5824
5825/*out must be buffer big enough to contain uncompressed IDAT chunk data, and in must contain the full image.
5826return value is error**/
5827static unsigned preProcessScanlines(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
5828 unsigned w, unsigned h,
5829 const LodePNGInfo* info_png, const LodePNGEncoderSettings* settings) {
5830 /*
5831 This function converts the pure 2D image with the PNG's colortype, into filtered-padded-interlaced data. Steps:
5832 *) if no Adam7: 1) add padding bits (= possible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8) 2) filter
5833 *) if adam7: 1) Adam7_interlace 2) 7x add padding bits 3) 7x filter
5834 */
5835 unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
5836 unsigned error = 0;
5837
5838 if(info_png->interlace_method == 0) {
5839 *outsize = h + (h * ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u)); /*image size plus an extra byte per scanline + possible padding bits*/
5840 *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
5841 if(!(*out) && (*outsize)) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5842
5843 if(!error) {
5844 /*non multiple of 8 bits per scanline, padding bits needed per scanline*/
5845 if(bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u) {
5846 unsigned char* padded = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(h * ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u));
5847 if(!padded) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5848 if(!error) {
5849 addPaddingBits(padded, in, ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, w * bpp, h);
5850 error = filter(*out, padded, w, h, &info_png->color, settings);
5851 }
5852 lodepng_free(padded);
5853 } else {
5854 /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
5855 error = filter(*out, in, w, h, &info_png->color, settings);
5856 }
5857 }
5858 } else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/ {
5859 unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
5860 size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
5861 unsigned char* adam7;
5862
5863 Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
5864
5865 *outsize = filter_passstart[7]; /*image size plus an extra byte per scanline + possible padding bits*/
5866 *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
5867 if(!(*out)) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5868
5869 adam7 = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(passstart[7]);
5870 if(!adam7 && passstart[7]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5871
5872 if(!error) {
5873 unsigned i;
5874
5875 Adam7_interlace(adam7, in, w, h, bpp);
5876 for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5877 if(bpp < 8) {
5878 unsigned char* padded = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(padded_passstart[i + 1] - padded_passstart[i]);
5879 if(!padded) ERROR_BREAK(83); /*alloc fail*/
5880 addPaddingBits(padded, &adam7[passstart[i]],
5881 ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, passw[i] * bpp, passh[i]);
5882 error = filter(&(*out)[filter_passstart[i]], padded,
5883 passw[i], passh[i], &info_png->color, settings);
5884 lodepng_free(padded);
5885 } else {
5886 error = filter(&(*out)[filter_passstart[i]], &adam7[padded_passstart[i]],
5887 passw[i], passh[i], &info_png->color, settings);
5888 }
5889
5890 if(error) break;
5891 }
5892 }
5893
5894 lodepng_free(adam7);
5895 }
5896
5897 return error;
5898}
5899
5900#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5901static unsigned addUnknownChunks(ucvector* out, unsigned char* data, size_t datasize) {
5902 unsigned char* inchunk = data;
5903 while((size_t)(inchunk - data) < datasize) {
5904 CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_append(&out->data, &out->size, inchunk));
5905 out->allocsize = out->size; /*fix the allocsize again*/
5906 inchunk = lodepng_chunk_next(inchunk, data + datasize);
5907 }
5908 return 0;
5909}
5910
5911static unsigned isGrayICCProfile(const unsigned char* profile, unsigned size) {
5912 /*
5913 It is a gray profile if bytes 16-19 are "GRAY", rgb profile if bytes 16-19
5914 are "RGB ". We do not perform any full parsing of the ICC profile here, other
5915 than check those 4 bytes to grayscale profile. Other than that, validity of
5916 the profile is not checked. This is needed only because the PNG specification
5917 requires using a non-gray color model if there is an ICC profile with "RGB "
5918 (sadly limiting compression opportunities if the input data is grayscale RGB
5919 data), and requires using a gray color model if it is "GRAY".
5920 */
5921 if(size < 20) return 0;
5922 return profile[16] == 'G' && profile[17] == 'R' && profile[18] == 'A' && profile[19] == 'Y';
5923}
5924
5925static unsigned isRGBICCProfile(const unsigned char* profile, unsigned size) {
5926 /* See comment in isGrayICCProfile*/
5927 if(size < 20) return 0;
5928 return profile[16] == 'R' && profile[17] == 'G' && profile[18] == 'B' && profile[19] == ' ';
5929}
5930#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5931
5932unsigned lodepng_encode(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
5933 const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h,
5934 LodePNGState* state) {
5935 unsigned char* data = 0; /*uncompressed version of the IDAT chunk data*/
5936 size_t datasize = 0;
5937 ucvector outv = ucvector_init(NULL, 0);
5938 LodePNGInfo info;
5939 const LodePNGInfo* info_png = &state->info_png;
5940 LodePNGColorMode auto_color;
5941
5942 lodepng_info_init(&info);
5943 lodepng_color_mode_init(&auto_color);
5944
5945 /*provide some proper output values if error will happen*/
5946 *out = 0;
5947 *outsize = 0;
5948 state->error = 0;
5949
5950 /*check input values validity*/
5951 if((info_png->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE || state->encoder.force_palette)
5952 && (info_png->color.palettesize == 0 || info_png->color.palettesize > 256)) {
5953 /*this error is returned even if auto_convert is enabled and thus encoder could
5954 generate the palette by itself: while allowing this could be possible in theory,
5955 it may complicate the code or edge cases, and always requiring to give a palette
5956 when setting this color type is a simpler contract*/
5957 state->error = 68; /*invalid palette size, it is only allowed to be 1-256*/
5958 goto cleanup;
5959 }
5960 if(state->encoder.zlibsettings.btype > 2) {
5961 state->error = 61; /*error: invalid btype*/
5962 goto cleanup;
5963 }
5964 if(info_png->interlace_method > 1) {
5965 state->error = 71; /*error: invalid interlace mode*/
5966 goto cleanup;
5967 }
5968 state->error = checkColorValidity(info_png->color.colortype, info_png->color.bitdepth);
5969 if(state->error) goto cleanup; /*error: invalid color type given*/
5970 state->error = checkColorValidity(state->info_raw.colortype, state->info_raw.bitdepth);
5971 if(state->error) goto cleanup; /*error: invalid color type given*/
5972
5973 /* color convert and compute scanline filter types */
5974 lodepng_info_copy(&info, &state->info_png);
5975 if(state->encoder.auto_convert) {
5976 LodePNGColorStats stats;
5977 unsigned allow_convert = 1;
5978 lodepng_color_stats_init(&stats);
5979#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5980 if(info_png->iccp_defined &&
5981 isGrayICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size)) {
5982 /*the PNG specification does not allow to use palette with a GRAY ICC profile, even
5983 if the palette has only gray colors, so disallow it.*/
5984 stats.allow_palette = 0;
5985 }
5986 if(info_png->iccp_defined &&
5987 isRGBICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size)) {
5988 /*the PNG specification does not allow to use grayscale color with RGB ICC profile, so disallow gray.*/
5989 stats.allow_greyscale = 0;
5990 }
5991#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5992 state->error = lodepng_compute_color_stats(&stats, image, w, h, &state->info_raw);
5993 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
5994#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5995 if(info_png->background_defined) {
5996 /*the background chunk's color must be taken into account as well*/
5997 unsigned r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
5998 LodePNGColorMode mode16 = lodepng_color_mode_make(LCT_RGB, 16);
5999 lodepng_convert_rgb(&r, &g, &b,
6000 info_png->background_r, info_png->background_g, info_png->background_b, &mode16, &info_png->color);
6001 state->error = lodepng_color_stats_add(&stats, r, g, b, 65535);
6002 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6003 }
6004#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
6005 state->error = auto_choose_color(&auto_color, &state->info_raw, &stats);
6006 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6007#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6008 if(info_png->sbit_defined) {
6009 /*if sbit is defined, due to strict requirements of which sbit values can be present for which color modes,
6010 auto_convert can't be done in many cases. However, do support a few cases here.
6011 TODO: more conversions may be possible, and it may also be possible to get a more appropriate color type out of
6012 auto_choose_color if knowledge about sbit is used beforehand
6013 */
6014 unsigned sbit_max = LODEPNG_MAX(LODEPNG_MAX(LODEPNG_MAX(info_png->sbit_r, info_png->sbit_g),
6015 info_png->sbit_b), info_png->sbit_a);
6016 unsigned equal = (!info_png->sbit_g || info_png->sbit_g == info_png->sbit_r)
6017 && (!info_png->sbit_b || info_png->sbit_b == info_png->sbit_r)
6018 && (!info_png->sbit_a || info_png->sbit_a == info_png->sbit_r);
6019 allow_convert = 0;
6020 if(info.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE &&
6021 auto_color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
6022 /* input and output are palette, and in this case it may happen that palette data is
6023 expected to be copied from info_raw into the info_png */
6024 allow_convert = 1;
6025 }
6026 /*going from 8-bit RGB to palette (or 16-bit as long as sbit_max <= 8) is possible
6027 since both are 8-bit RGB for sBIT's purposes*/
6028 if(info.color.colortype == LCT_RGB &&
6029 auto_color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE && sbit_max <= 8) {
6030 allow_convert = 1;
6031 }
6032 /*going from 8-bit RGBA to palette is also ok but only if sbit_a is exactly 8*/
6033 if(info.color.colortype == LCT_RGBA && auto_color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE &&
6034 info_png->sbit_a == 8 && sbit_max <= 8) {
6035 allow_convert = 1;
6036 }
6037 /*going from 16-bit RGB(A) to 8-bit RGB(A) is ok if all sbit values are <= 8*/
6038 if((info.color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info.color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) && info.color.bitdepth == 16 &&
6039 auto_color.colortype == info.color.colortype && auto_color.bitdepth == 8 &&
6040 sbit_max <= 8) {
6041 allow_convert = 1;
6042 }
6043 /*going to less channels is ok if all bit values are equal (all possible values in sbit,
6044 as well as the chosen bitdepth of the result). Due to how auto_convert works,
6045 we already know that auto_color.colortype has less than or equal amount of channels than
6046 info.colortype. Palette is not used here. This conversion is not allowed if
6047 info_png->sbit_r < auto_color.bitdepth, because specifically for alpha, non-presence of
6048 an sbit value heavily implies that alpha's bit depth is equal to the PNG bit depth (rather
6049 than the bit depths set in the r, g and b sbit values, by how the PNG specification describes
6050 handling tRNS chunk case with sBIT), so be conservative here about ignoring user input.*/
6051 if(info.color.colortype != LCT_PALETTE && auto_color.colortype != LCT_PALETTE &&
6052 equal && info_png->sbit_r == auto_color.bitdepth) {
6053 allow_convert = 1;
6054 }
6055 }
6056#endif
6057 if(state->encoder.force_palette) {
6058 if(info.color.colortype != LCT_GREY && info.color.colortype != LCT_GREY_ALPHA &&
6059 (auto_color.colortype == LCT_GREY || auto_color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA)) {
6060 /*user speficially forced a PLTE palette, so cannot convert to grayscale types because
6061 the PNG specification only allows writing a suggested palette in PLTE for truecolor types*/
6062 allow_convert = 0;
6063 }
6064 }
6065 if(allow_convert) {
6066 lodepng_color_mode_copy(&info.color, &auto_color);
6067#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6068 /*also convert the background chunk*/
6069 if(info_png->background_defined) {
6070 if(lodepng_convert_rgb(&info.background_r, &info.background_g, &info.background_b,
6071 info_png->background_r, info_png->background_g, info_png->background_b, &info.color, &info_png->color)) {
6072 state->error = 104;
6073 goto cleanup;
6074 }
6075 }
6076#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
6077 }
6078 }
6079#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6080 if(info_png->iccp_defined) {
6081 unsigned gray_icc = isGrayICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size);
6082 unsigned rgb_icc = isRGBICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size);
6083 unsigned gray_png = info.color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info.color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA;
6084 if(!gray_icc && !rgb_icc) {
6085 state->error = 100; /* Disallowed profile color type for PNG */
6086 goto cleanup;
6087 }
6088 if(gray_icc != gray_png) {
6089 /*Not allowed to use RGB/RGBA/palette with GRAY ICC profile or vice versa,
6090 or in case of auto_convert, it wasn't possible to find appropriate model*/
6091 state->error = state->encoder.auto_convert ? 102 : 101;
6092 goto cleanup;
6093 }
6094 }
6095#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6096 if(!lodepng_color_mode_equal(&state->info_raw, &info.color)) {
6097 unsigned char* converted;
6098 size_t size = ((size_t)w * (size_t)h * (size_t)lodepng_get_bpp(&info.color) + 7u) / 8u;
6099
6100 converted = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(size);
6101 if(!converted && size) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
6102 if(!state->error) {
6103 state->error = lodepng_convert(converted, image, &info.color, &state->info_raw, w, h);
6104 }
6105 if(!state->error) {
6106 state->error = preProcessScanlines(&data, &datasize, converted, w, h, &info, &state->encoder);
6107 }
6108 lodepng_free(converted);
6109 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6110 } else {
6111 state->error = preProcessScanlines(&data, &datasize, image, w, h, &info, &state->encoder);
6112 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6113 }
6114
6115 /* output all PNG chunks */ {
6116#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6117 size_t i;
6118#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6119 /*write signature and chunks*/
6120 state->error = writeSignature(&outv);
6121 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6122 /*IHDR*/
6123 state->error = addChunk_IHDR(&outv, w, h, info.color.colortype, info.color.bitdepth, info.interlace_method);
6124 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6125#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6126 /*unknown chunks between IHDR and PLTE*/
6127 if(info.unknown_chunks_data[0]) {
6128 state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[0], info.unknown_chunks_size[0]);
6129 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6130 }
6131 /*color profile chunks must come before PLTE */
6132 if(info.iccp_defined) {
6133 state->error = addChunk_iCCP(&outv, &info, &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6134 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6135 }
6136 if(info.srgb_defined) {
6137 state->error = addChunk_sRGB(&outv, &info);
6138 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6139 }
6140 if(info.gama_defined) {
6141 state->error = addChunk_gAMA(&outv, &info);
6142 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6143 }
6144 if(info.chrm_defined) {
6145 state->error = addChunk_cHRM(&outv, &info);
6146 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6147 }
6148 if(info_png->sbit_defined) {
6149 state->error = addChunk_sBIT(&outv, &info);
6150 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6151 }
6152#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6153 /*PLTE*/
6154 if(info.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
6155 state->error = addChunk_PLTE(&outv, &info.color);
6156 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6157 }
6158 if(state->encoder.force_palette && (info.color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info.color.colortype == LCT_RGBA)) {
6159 /*force_palette means: write suggested palette for truecolor in PLTE chunk*/
6160 state->error = addChunk_PLTE(&outv, &info.color);
6161 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6162 }
6163 /*tRNS (this will only add if when necessary) */
6164 state->error = addChunk_tRNS(&outv, &info.color);
6165 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6166#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6167 /*bKGD (must come between PLTE and the IDAt chunks*/
6168 if(info.background_defined) {
6169 state->error = addChunk_bKGD(&outv, &info);
6170 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6171 }
6172 /*pHYs (must come before the IDAT chunks)*/
6173 if(info.phys_defined) {
6174 state->error = addChunk_pHYs(&outv, &info);
6175 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6176 }
6177
6178 /*unknown chunks between PLTE and IDAT*/
6179 if(info.unknown_chunks_data[1]) {
6180 state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[1], info.unknown_chunks_size[1]);
6181 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6182 }
6183#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6184 /*IDAT (multiple IDAT chunks must be consecutive)*/
6185 state->error = addChunk_IDAT(&outv, data, datasize, &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6186 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6187#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6188 /*tIME*/
6189 if(info.time_defined) {
6190 state->error = addChunk_tIME(&outv, &info.time);
6191 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6192 }
6193 /*tEXt and/or zTXt*/
6194 for(i = 0; i != info.text_num; ++i) {
6195 if(lodepng_strlen(info.text_keys[i]) > 79) {
6196 state->error = 66; /*text chunk too large*/
6197 goto cleanup;
6198 }
6199 if(lodepng_strlen(info.text_keys[i]) < 1) {
6200 state->error = 67; /*text chunk too small*/
6201 goto cleanup;
6202 }
6203 if(state->encoder.text_compression) {
6204 state->error = addChunk_zTXt(&outv, info.text_keys[i], info.text_strings[i], &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6205 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6206 } else {
6207 state->error = addChunk_tEXt(&outv, info.text_keys[i], info.text_strings[i]);
6208 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6209 }
6210 }
6211 /*LodePNG version id in text chunk*/
6212 if(state->encoder.add_id) {
6213 unsigned already_added_id_text = 0;
6214 for(i = 0; i != info.text_num; ++i) {
6215 const char* k = info.text_keys[i];
6216 /* Could use strcmp, but we're not calling or reimplementing this C library function for this use only */
6217 if(k[0] == 'L' && k[1] == 'o' && k[2] == 'd' && k[3] == 'e' &&
6218 k[4] == 'P' && k[5] == 'N' && k[6] == 'G' && k[7] == '\0') {
6219 already_added_id_text = 1;
6220 break;
6221 }
6222 }
6223 if(already_added_id_text == 0) {
6224 state->error = addChunk_tEXt(&outv, "LodePNG", LODEPNG_VERSION_STRING); /*it's shorter as tEXt than as zTXt chunk*/
6225 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6226 }
6227 }
6228 /*iTXt*/
6229 for(i = 0; i != info.itext_num; ++i) {
6230 if(lodepng_strlen(info.itext_keys[i]) > 79) {
6231 state->error = 66; /*text chunk too large*/
6232 goto cleanup;
6233 }
6234 if(lodepng_strlen(info.itext_keys[i]) < 1) {
6235 state->error = 67; /*text chunk too small*/
6236 goto cleanup;
6237 }
6238 state->error = addChunk_iTXt(
6239 &outv, state->encoder.text_compression,
6240 info.itext_keys[i], info.itext_langtags[i], info.itext_transkeys[i], info.itext_strings[i],
6241 &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6242 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6243 }
6244
6245 /*unknown chunks between IDAT and IEND*/
6246 if(info.unknown_chunks_data[2]) {
6247 state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[2], info.unknown_chunks_size[2]);
6248 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6249 }
6250#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6251 state->error = addChunk_IEND(&outv);
6252 if(state->error) goto cleanup;
6253 }
6254
6255cleanup:
6256 lodepng_info_cleanup(&info);
6257 lodepng_free(data);
6258 lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&auto_color);
6259
6260 /*instead of cleaning the vector up, give it to the output*/
6261 *out = outv.data;
6262 *outsize = outv.size;
6263
6264 return state->error;
6265}
6266
6267unsigned lodepng_encode_memory(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* image,
6268 unsigned w, unsigned h, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6269 unsigned error;
6270 LodePNGState state;
6271 lodepng_state_init(&state);
6272 state.info_raw.colortype = colortype;
6273 state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
6274 state.info_png.color.colortype = colortype;
6275 state.info_png.color.bitdepth = bitdepth;
6276 lodepng_encode(out, outsize, image, w, h, &state);
6277 error = state.error;
6278 lodepng_state_cleanup(&state);
6279 return error;
6280}
6281
6282unsigned lodepng_encode32(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6283 return lodepng_encode_memory(out, outsize, image, w, h, LCT_RGBA, 8);
6284}
6285
6286unsigned lodepng_encode24(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6287 return lodepng_encode_memory(out, outsize, image, w, h, LCT_RGB, 8);
6288}
6289
6290#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6291unsigned lodepng_encode_file(const char* filename, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6292 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6293 unsigned char* buffer;
6294 size_t buffersize;
6295 unsigned error = lodepng_encode_memory(&buffer, &buffersize, image, w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6296 if(!error) error = lodepng_save_file(buffer, buffersize, filename);
6297 lodepng_free(buffer);
6298 return error;
6299}
6300
6301unsigned lodepng_encode32_file(const char* filename, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6302 return lodepng_encode_file(filename, image, w, h, LCT_RGBA, 8);
6303}
6304
6305unsigned lodepng_encode24_file(const char* filename, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6306 return lodepng_encode_file(filename, image, w, h, LCT_RGB, 8);
6307}
6308#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK*/
6309
6310void lodepng_encoder_settings_init(LodePNGEncoderSettings* settings) {
6311 lodepng_compress_settings_init(&settings->zlibsettings);
6312 settings->filter_palette_zero = 1;
6313 settings->filter_strategy = LFS_MINSUM;
6314 settings->auto_convert = 1;
6315 settings->force_palette = 0;
6316 settings->predefined_filters = 0;
6317#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6318 settings->add_id = 0;
6319 settings->text_compression = 1;
6320#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6321}
6322
6323#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
6324#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG*/
6325
6326#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ERROR_TEXT
6327/*
6328This returns the description of a numerical error code in English. This is also
6329the documentation of all the error codes.
6330*/
6331const char* lodepng_error_text(unsigned code) {
6332 switch(code) {
6333 case 0: return "no error, everything went ok";
6334 case 1: return "nothing done yet"; /*the Encoder/Decoder has done nothing yet, error checking makes no sense yet*/
6335 case 10: return "end of input memory reached without huffman end code"; /*while huffman decoding*/
6336 case 11: return "error in code tree made it jump outside of huffman tree"; /*while huffman decoding*/
6337 case 13: return "problem while processing dynamic deflate block";
6338 case 14: return "problem while processing dynamic deflate block";
6339 case 15: return "problem while processing dynamic deflate block";
6340 /*this error could happen if there are only 0 or 1 symbols present in the huffman code:*/
6341 case 16: return "invalid code while processing dynamic deflate block";
6342 case 17: return "end of out buffer memory reached while inflating";
6343 case 18: return "invalid distance code while inflating";
6344 case 19: return "end of out buffer memory reached while inflating";
6345 case 20: return "invalid deflate block BTYPE encountered while decoding";
6346 case 21: return "NLEN is not ones complement of LEN in a deflate block";
6347
6348 /*end of out buffer memory reached while inflating:
6349 This can happen if the inflated deflate data is longer than the amount of bytes required to fill up
6350 all the pixels of the image, given the color depth and image dimensions. Something that doesn't
6351 happen in a normal, well encoded, PNG image.*/
6352 case 22: return "end of out buffer memory reached while inflating";
6353 case 23: return "end of in buffer memory reached while inflating";
6354 case 24: return "invalid FCHECK in zlib header";
6355 case 25: return "invalid compression method in zlib header";
6356 case 26: return "FDICT encountered in zlib header while it's not used for PNG";
6357 case 27: return "PNG file is smaller than a PNG header";
6358 /*Checks the magic file header, the first 8 bytes of the PNG file*/
6359 case 28: return "incorrect PNG signature, it's no PNG or corrupted";
6360 case 29: return "first chunk is not the header chunk";
6361 case 30: return "chunk length too large, chunk broken off at end of file";
6362 case 31: return "illegal PNG color type or bpp";
6363 case 32: return "illegal PNG compression method";
6364 case 33: return "illegal PNG filter method";
6365 case 34: return "illegal PNG interlace method";
6366 case 35: return "chunk length of a chunk is too large or the chunk too small";
6367 case 36: return "illegal PNG filter type encountered";
6368 case 37: return "illegal bit depth for this color type given";
6369 case 38: return "the palette is too small or too big"; /*0, or more than 256 colors*/
6370 case 39: return "tRNS chunk before PLTE or has more entries than palette size";
6371 case 40: return "tRNS chunk has wrong size for grayscale image";
6372 case 41: return "tRNS chunk has wrong size for RGB image";
6373 case 42: return "tRNS chunk appeared while it was not allowed for this color type";
6374 case 43: return "bKGD chunk has wrong size for palette image";
6375 case 44: return "bKGD chunk has wrong size for grayscale image";
6376 case 45: return "bKGD chunk has wrong size for RGB image";
6377 case 48: return "empty input buffer given to decoder. Maybe caused by non-existing file?";
6378 case 49: return "jumped past memory while generating dynamic huffman tree";
6379 case 50: return "jumped past memory while generating dynamic huffman tree";
6380 case 51: return "jumped past memory while inflating huffman block";
6381 case 52: return "jumped past memory while inflating";
6382 case 53: return "size of zlib data too small";
6383 case 54: return "repeat symbol in tree while there was no value symbol yet";
6384 /*jumped past tree while generating huffman tree, this could be when the
6385 tree will have more leaves than symbols after generating it out of the
6386 given lengths. They call this an oversubscribed dynamic bit lengths tree in zlib.*/
6387 case 55: return "jumped past tree while generating huffman tree";
6388 case 56: return "given output image colortype or bitdepth not supported for color conversion";
6389 case 57: return "invalid CRC encountered (checking CRC can be disabled)";
6390 case 58: return "invalid ADLER32 encountered (checking ADLER32 can be disabled)";
6391 case 59: return "requested color conversion not supported";
6392 case 60: return "invalid window size given in the settings of the encoder (must be 0-32768)";
6393 case 61: return "invalid BTYPE given in the settings of the encoder (only 0, 1 and 2 are allowed)";
6394 /*LodePNG leaves the choice of RGB to grayscale conversion formula to the user.*/
6395 case 62: return "conversion from color to grayscale not supported";
6396 /*(2^31-1)*/
6397 case 63: return "length of a chunk too long, max allowed for PNG is 2147483647 bytes per chunk";
6398 /*this would result in the inability of a deflated block to ever contain an end code. It must be at least 1.*/
6399 case 64: return "the length of the END symbol 256 in the Huffman tree is 0";
6400 case 66: return "the length of a text chunk keyword given to the encoder is longer than the maximum of 79 bytes";
6401 case 67: return "the length of a text chunk keyword given to the encoder is smaller than the minimum of 1 byte";
6402 case 68: return "tried to encode a PLTE chunk with a palette that has less than 1 or more than 256 colors";
6403 case 69: return "unknown chunk type with 'critical' flag encountered by the decoder";
6404 case 71: return "invalid interlace mode given to encoder (must be 0 or 1)";
6405 case 72: return "while decoding, invalid compression method encountering in zTXt or iTXt chunk (it must be 0)";
6406 case 73: return "invalid tIME chunk size";
6407 case 74: return "invalid pHYs chunk size";
6408 /*length could be wrong, or data chopped off*/
6409 case 75: return "no null termination char found while decoding text chunk";
6410 case 76: return "iTXt chunk too short to contain required bytes";
6411 case 77: return "integer overflow in buffer size";
6412 case 78: return "failed to open file for reading"; /*file doesn't exist or couldn't be opened for reading*/
6413 case 79: return "failed to open file for writing";
6414 case 80: return "tried creating a tree of 0 symbols";
6415 case 81: return "lazy matching at pos 0 is impossible";
6416 case 82: return "color conversion to palette requested while a color isn't in palette, or index out of bounds";
6417 case 83: return "memory allocation failed";
6418 case 84: return "given image too small to contain all pixels to be encoded";
6419 case 86: return "impossible offset in lz77 encoding (internal bug)";
6420 case 87: return "must provide custom zlib function pointer if LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB is not defined";
6421 case 88: return "invalid filter strategy given for LodePNGEncoderSettings.filter_strategy";
6422 case 89: return "text chunk keyword too short or long: must have size 1-79";
6423 /*the windowsize in the LodePNGCompressSettings. Requiring POT(==> & instead of %) makes encoding 12% faster.*/
6424 case 90: return "windowsize must be a power of two";
6425 case 91: return "invalid decompressed idat size";
6426 case 92: return "integer overflow due to too many pixels";
6427 case 93: return "zero width or height is invalid";
6428 case 94: return "header chunk must have a size of 13 bytes";
6429 case 95: return "integer overflow with combined idat chunk size";
6430 case 96: return "invalid gAMA chunk size";
6431 case 97: return "invalid cHRM chunk size";
6432 case 98: return "invalid sRGB chunk size";
6433 case 99: return "invalid sRGB rendering intent";
6434 case 100: return "invalid ICC profile color type, the PNG specification only allows RGB or GRAY";
6435 case 101: return "PNG specification does not allow RGB ICC profile on gray color types and vice versa";
6436 case 102: return "not allowed to set grayscale ICC profile with colored pixels by PNG specification";
6437 case 103: return "invalid palette index in bKGD chunk. Maybe it came before PLTE chunk?";
6438 case 104: return "invalid bKGD color while encoding (e.g. palette index out of range)";
6439 case 105: return "integer overflow of bitsize";
6440 case 106: return "PNG file must have PLTE chunk if color type is palette";
6441 case 107: return "color convert from palette mode requested without setting the palette data in it";
6442 case 108: return "tried to add more than 256 values to a palette";
6443 /*this limit can be configured in LodePNGDecompressSettings*/
6444 case 109: return "tried to decompress zlib or deflate data larger than desired max_output_size";
6445 case 110: return "custom zlib or inflate decompression failed";
6446 case 111: return "custom zlib or deflate compression failed";
6447 /*max text size limit can be configured in LodePNGDecoderSettings. This error prevents
6448 unreasonable memory consumption when decoding due to impossibly large text sizes.*/
6449 case 112: return "compressed text unreasonably large";
6450 /*max ICC size limit can be configured in LodePNGDecoderSettings. This error prevents
6451 unreasonable memory consumption when decoding due to impossibly large ICC profile*/
6452 case 113: return "ICC profile unreasonably large";
6453 case 114: return "sBIT chunk has wrong size for the color type of the image";
6454 case 115: return "sBIT value out of range";
6455 }
6456 return "unknown error code";
6457}
6458#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ERROR_TEXT*/
6459
6460/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6461/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6462/* // C++ Wrapper // */
6463/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6464/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6465
6466#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_CPP
6467namespace lodepng {
6468
6469#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6470unsigned load_file(std::vector<unsigned char>& buffer, const std::string& filename) {
6471 long size = lodepng_filesize(filename.c_str());
6472 if(size < 0) return 78;
6473 buffer.resize((size_t)size);
6474 return size == 0 ? 0 : lodepng_buffer_file(&buffer[0], (size_t)size, filename.c_str());
6475}
6476
6477/*write given buffer to the file, overwriting the file, it doesn't append to it.*/
6478unsigned save_file(const std::vector<unsigned char>& buffer, const std::string& filename) {
6479 return lodepng_save_file(buffer.empty() ? 0 : &buffer[0], buffer.size(), filename.c_str());
6480}
6481#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK */
6482
6483#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB
6484#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
6485unsigned decompress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
6486 const LodePNGDecompressSettings& settings) {
6487 unsigned char* buffer = 0;
6488 size_t buffersize = 0;
6489 unsigned error = zlib_decompress(&buffer, &buffersize, 0, in, insize, &settings);
6490 if(buffer) {
6491 out.insert(out.end(), buffer, &buffer[buffersize]);
6492 lodepng_free(buffer);
6493 }
6494 return error;
6495}
6496
6497unsigned decompress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const std::vector<unsigned char>& in,
6498 const LodePNGDecompressSettings& settings) {
6499 return decompress(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], in.size(), settings);
6500}
6501#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER */
6502
6503#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
6504unsigned compress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
6505 const LodePNGCompressSettings& settings) {
6506 unsigned char* buffer = 0;
6507 size_t buffersize = 0;
6508 unsigned error = zlib_compress(&buffer, &buffersize, in, insize, &settings);
6509 if(buffer) {
6510 out.insert(out.end(), buffer, &buffer[buffersize]);
6511 lodepng_free(buffer);
6512 }
6513 return error;
6514}
6515
6516unsigned compress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const std::vector<unsigned char>& in,
6517 const LodePNGCompressSettings& settings) {
6518 return compress(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], in.size(), settings);
6519}
6520#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER */
6521#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB */
6522
6523
6524#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG
6525
6526State::State() {
6527 lodepng_state_init(this);
6528}
6529
6530State::State(const State& other) {
6531 lodepng_state_init(this);
6532 lodepng_state_copy(this, &other);
6533}
6534
6535State::~State() {
6536 lodepng_state_cleanup(this);
6537}
6538
6539State& State::operator=(const State& other) {
6540 lodepng_state_copy(this, &other);
6541 return *this;
6542}
6543
6544#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
6545
6546unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h, const unsigned char* in,
6547 size_t insize, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6548 unsigned char* buffer = 0;
6549 unsigned error = lodepng_decode_memory(&buffer, &w, &h, in, insize, colortype, bitdepth);
6550 if(buffer && !error) {
6551 State state;
6552 state.info_raw.colortype = colortype;
6553 state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
6554 size_t buffersize = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, &state.info_raw);
6555 out.insert(out.end(), buffer, &buffer[buffersize]);
6556 }
6557 lodepng_free(buffer);
6558 return error;
6559}
6560
6561unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h,
6562 const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6563 return decode(out, w, h, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], (unsigned)in.size(), colortype, bitdepth);
6564}
6565
6566unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h,
6567 State& state,
6568 const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
6569 unsigned char* buffer = NULL;
6570 unsigned error = lodepng_decode(&buffer, &w, &h, &state, in, insize);
6571 if(buffer && !error) {
6572 size_t buffersize = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, &state.info_raw);
6573 out.insert(out.end(), buffer, &buffer[buffersize]);
6574 }
6575 lodepng_free(buffer);
6576 return error;
6577}
6578
6579unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h,
6580 State& state,
6581 const std::vector<unsigned char>& in) {
6582 return decode(out, w, h, state, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], in.size());
6583}
6584
6585#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6586unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h, const std::string& filename,
6587 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6588 std::vector<unsigned char> buffer;
6589 /* safe output values in case error happens */
6590 w = h = 0;
6591 unsigned error = load_file(buffer, filename);
6592 if(error) return error;
6593 return decode(out, w, h, buffer, colortype, bitdepth);
6594}
6595#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER */
6596#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK */
6597
6598#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
6599unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6600 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6601 unsigned char* buffer;
6602 size_t buffersize;
6603 unsigned error = lodepng_encode_memory(&buffer, &buffersize, in, w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6604 if(buffer) {
6605 out.insert(out.end(), buffer, &buffer[buffersize]);
6606 lodepng_free(buffer);
6607 }
6608 return error;
6609}
6610
6611unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out,
6612 const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6613 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6614 if(lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(w, h, colortype, bitdepth) > in.size()) return 84;
6615 return encode(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6616}
6617
6618unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out,
6619 const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6620 State& state) {
6621 unsigned char* buffer;
6622 size_t buffersize;
6623 unsigned error = lodepng_encode(&buffer, &buffersize, in, w, h, &state);
6624 if(buffer) {
6625 out.insert(out.end(), buffer, &buffer[buffersize]);
6626 lodepng_free(buffer);
6627 }
6628 return error;
6629}
6630
6631unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out,
6632 const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6633 State& state) {
6634 if(lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, &state.info_raw) > in.size()) return 84;
6635 return encode(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], w, h, state);
6636}
6637
6638#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6639unsigned encode(const std::string& filename,
6640 const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6641 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6642 std::vector<unsigned char> buffer;
6643 unsigned error = encode(buffer, in, w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6644 if(!error) error = save_file(buffer, filename);
6645 return error;
6646}
6647
6648unsigned encode(const std::string& filename,
6649 const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6650 LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6651 if(lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(w, h, colortype, bitdepth) > in.size()) return 84;
6652 return encode(filename, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6653}
6654#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK */
6655#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER */
6656#endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG */
6657} /* namespace lodepng */
6658#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_CPP*/
